ny: Komabe, dalaivalayo anavulala kwambiri kumutu.

en: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT.
ny: Msewu womwe unachitika ngoziyi unatsekedwa kwakanthawi pomwe ntchito zadzidzidzi zinamasula dalaivala ku Audi TT yofiira.

en: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.
ny: Poyamba anagonekedwa m'chipatala cha James Paget ku Great Yarmouth.

en: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
ny: Pambuyo pake anasamutsidwira ku Chipatala cha Addenbrooke ku Cambridge.

en: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son.
ny: Adekoya kuyambira nthawi imeneyo wakhala ku khoti la Edinburgh Sheriff Court ndi mlandu wopha mwana wake.

en: She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published.
ny: Iye ali m'ndende podikira kuimbidwa mlandu ndi kuzengedwa mlandu, koma umboni uliwonse wa mboni zoona ndi maso ungaipitsidwe chifukwa chakuti chithunzi chake chafalitsidwa kwambiri.

en: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.
ny: Izi ndizofala kwina kulikonse ku UK koma chilungamo cha ku Scotland chimagwira ntchito mosiyana ndipo makhoti awona kufalitsa zithunzi ngati zomwe zingakhale tsankho.

en: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."
ny: Pulofesa Pamela Ferguson wa pa yunivesite ya Dundee akuti "atolankhani amachita kuoneka kuti akuyenda mzere woopsa ngati akufalitsa zithunzi etc za anthu omwe akukayikira."

en: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
ny: Ofesi ya Crown, yomwe ikuyang'anira milandu yonse, yasonyeza kwa atolankhani kuti palibe ndemanga ina yomwe idzaperekedwe mpaka kuimbidwa mlandu.

en: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.
ny: Chikalatacho, malinga ndi kutayika, chidzatanthauza mkangano wa malire, womwe Palestina ikufuna potengera malire pamaso pa nkhondo ya Mideast ya 1967.

en: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.
ny: Nkhani zina zomwe zafotokozedwa zikunenedwa kuti zikuphatikizapo mkhalidwe wamtsogolo wa Yerusalemu womwe uli wopatulika kwa mitundu yonse ndi nkhani ya Jordan Valley.

en: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.
ny: Israel ikufuna kukhalapo kwa asilikali kosalekeza m'chigwachi kwa zaka khumi pamene mgwirizano wasainidwa pamene PA ikuvomereza kusiya kukhalapo koteroko kwa zaka zisanu zokha.

en: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.
ny: Owombera mu mayesero owonjezera oletsa tizilombo toyambitsa matenda anayenera kuyang'aniridwa kwambiri ndi oyang'anira, popeza mayeserowo adayang'aniridwa ndipo mphamvu zake zimayesedwa.

en: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.
ny: Mu mgwirizano wa NPWS ndi Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, odzipereka oyenerera analembedwa ntchito, pansi pa pulogalamu yosaka ya Sporting Shooters Association.

en: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.
ny: Malinga ndi Mick O'Flynn, Mtsogoleri Wogwira Ntchito Park Conservation and Heritage ndi NPWS, owombera anayi omwe adasankhidwa pa ntchito yoyamba kuwombera adalandira chitetezo chokwanira ndi malangizo ophunzitsira.

en: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.
ny: Martelly analumbira mu bungwe latsopano la Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) la mamembala asanu ndi anayi dzulo.

en: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.
ny: Ndi CEP yachisanu ya Martelly m'zaka zinayi.

en: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.
ny: Mwezi watha bungwe la pulezidenti linalimbikitsa kuti CEP isanayambe kusiya ntchito monga gawo la phukusi la njira zopititsira dziko ku chisankho chatsopano.

en: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.
ny: Bungweli linali yankho la Martelly pa zionetsero zofala zotsutsana ndi boma zomwe zinayamba mu Okutobala.

en: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.
ny: Zionetsero zachiwawa nthawi zina zinayambitsidwa ndi kulephera kuchita zisankho, zina zikuyenera kuyambira 2011.

en: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.
ny: Kuzungulira milandu 60 ya iPods yosagwira bwino ntchito yotentha kwambiri yanenedwa, kuyambitsa moto wasanu ndi umodzi ndikusiya anthu anayi ndi moto waung'ono.

en: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.
ny: Unduna wa Zachuma, Zamalonda ndi Makampani ku Japan (METI) adati adadziwa za ngozi 27 zokhudzana ndi zipangizozi.

en: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."
ny: Sabata yatha, METI inalengeza kuti Apple yadziwitsa za zochitika zina 34 zowonjezera kutentha kwambiri, zomwe kampaniyo idatcha "zopanda pake."

en: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."
ny: Undunawu unayankha mwa kutcha kusintha kwa Apple kwa lipoti "zomvetsa chisoni kwambiri."

en: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).
ny: The eathquake anakantha Mariana pa 07:19 m'mawa nthawi m'deralo (09:19 madzulo GMT Lachisanu).

en: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.
ny: Ofesi yoyang'anira ngozi zadzidzidzi ku Northern Marianas inanena kuti palibe zowonongeka zomwe zanenedwa m'dzikoli.

en: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.
ny: Komanso bungwe la Pacific Tsunami Warning Center linanena kuti panalibe chizindikiro cha Tsunami.

en: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.
ny: Wapolisi wakale wa ku Philippines wasunga alendo a ku Hong Kong ukapolo mwa kulanda basi yawo ku Manila, likulu la Philippines.

en: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.
ny: Rolando Mendoza anawombera mfuti yake ya M16 kwa alendo.

en: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.
ny: Ogwidwa angapo apulumutsidwa ndipo osachepera asanu ndi mmodzi atsimikiziridwa kuti afa mpaka pano.

en: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.
ny: Ogwidwa asanu ndi mmodzi, kuphatikizapo ana ndi okalamba, anamasulidwa msanga, monga momwe analili ojambula zithunzi a ku Philippines.

en: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.
ny: Pambuyo pake ojambula zithunzi anatenga malo a mayi wina wokalamba popeza ankafuna chimbudzi. Mendoza anawomberedwa.

en: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
ny: Liggins anatsatira mapazi a bambo ake ndipo analowa ntchito ya zamankhwala.

en: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.
ny: Anaphunzitsidwa kukhala dokotala wobereka ndipo anayamba kugwira ntchito ku chipatala cha Auckland's National Women's Hospital mu 1959.

en: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.
ny: Pamene anali kugwira ntchito kuchipatala Liggins anayamba kufufuza ntchito yobereka msanga panthawi yake yopuma.

en: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.
ny: Kafukufuku wake anasonyeza kuti ngati mahomoni aperekedwa adzafulumiza kukhwima kwa m'mapapo a mluza wa mwanayo.

en: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.
ny: Xinhua adanena kuti ofufuza a boma adapeza zolemba ndege ziwiri za 'bokosi lakuda' Lachitatu.

en: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
ny: Omenyera anzake anaperekanso msonkho kwa Luna.

en: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."
ny: Tommy Dreamer adati "Luna anali Mfumukazi yoyamba ya Extreme. Manejala wanga woyamba. Luna anamwalira usiku wa miyezi iwiri. Wokongola wapadera monga iye. Mkazi wamphamvu."

en: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."
ny: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels adanena kuti "Luna anali freaky ngati ine ... mwina ngakhale zambiri ... kumukonda ndipo adzamusowa... tikukhulupirira kuti ali pamalo abwino."

en: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.
ny: Mwa anthu 1,400 omwe anafunsidwa chisankho cha boma cha 2010 chisanachitike, omwe amatsutsa kuti Australia ikhale republic adakula ndi 8 peresenti kuyambira 2008.

en: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.
ny: Wosamalira Nduna Yaikulu Julia Gillard adanena panthawi ya kampeni ya chisankho cha federal cha 2010 kuti adakhulupirira kuti Australia iyenera kukhala republic kumapeto kwa ulamuliro wa Mfumukazi Elizabeth II.

en: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
ny: Anthu 34 pa 100 alionse amene ali pa kafukufukuyu amagwirizana ndi maganizo amenewa, ndipo akufuna kuti Mfumukazi Elizabeth II ikhale mfumu yomaliza ya dziko la Australia.

en: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.
ny: Pa kunyanyira kwa kafukufukuyu, 29 peresenti ya omwe anafunsidwa amakhulupirira kuti Australia iyenera kukhala lipabuliki mwamsanga, pamene 31 peresenti amakhulupirira kuti Australia sayenera kukhala lipabuliki.

en: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.
ny: Wopambana golide wa Olimpiki anayenera kusambira mu 100m ndi 200m freestyle komanso mu relays atatu ku Commonwealth Games, koma chifukwa cha madandaulo ake kulimba kwake kwakhala kokayikitsa.

en: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.
ny: Iye walephera kumwa mankhwala ofunikira kuti athetse ululu wake pamene akuletsedwa ku Masewera.

en: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.
ny: Curtis Cooper, yemwe ndi katswiri wa masamu komanso pulofesa wa sayansi ya makompyuta pa yunivesite ya Central Missouri, wapeza chiwerengero chachikulu kwambiri chodziwika mpaka pano pa January 25.

en: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.
ny: Anthu angapo anatsimikizira kupezeka pogwiritsa ntchito hardware ndi mapulogalamu osiyanasiyana kumayambiriro kwa mwezi wa February ndipo adalengezedwa Lachiwiri.

en: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.
ny: Mwinamwake ma comet angakhale anali magwero a kutumiza madzi padziko lapansi limodzi ndi zinthu zamoyo zimene zingapange mapuloteni ndi kuchirikiza moyo.

en: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.
ny: Asayansi akuyembekeza kumvetsa mmene mapulaneti amapangidwira, makamaka mmene Dziko lapansi linapangidwira, popeza kuti ma comet anagundana ndi Dziko lapansi kalekale.

en: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.
ny: Cuomo, 53, adayamba kazembe wake kumayambiriro kwa chaka chino ndipo adasaina lamulo mwezi watha loletsa ukwati wa amuna kapena akazi okhaokha.

en: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness".
ny: Iye anatchula mphekesera monga "kulankhula kwa ndale ndi zopusa".

en: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.
ny: Akuganiza kuti adzapanga run for president mu 2016.

en: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.
ny: NextGen ndi dongosolo limene FAA imanena kuti lingalole ndege kuuluka njira zazifupi ndi kupulumutsa mamiliyoni a malita a mafuta chaka chilichonse ndi kudula mpweya wa carbon.

en: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
ny: Amagwiritsa ntchito luso la satellite mosiyana ndi luso lakale lapansi la radar kuti alole oyang'anira ndege kuti adziwe ndege molondola kwambiri ndikupatsa oyendetsa ndege zambiri zolondola.

en: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.
ny: Palibe mayendedwe owonjezera omwe akuyikidwa ndipo sitima zapamtunda sizidzaima ku Wembley, ndipo malo osungirako magalimoto ndi malo osungirako magalimoto ndi kukwera sapezeka pansi.

en: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.
ny: Kuopa kusowa kwa mayendedwe kunayambitsa mwayi woti masewerawa adzakakamizidwa kusewera kuseri kwa zitseko zotsekedwa popanda othandizira timuyi.

en: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.
ny: Kafukufuku wofalitsidwa Lachinayi m'magazini ya Science adanena za mapangidwe a mtundu watsopano wa mbalame ku Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.

en: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
ny: Ofufuza ochokera ku yunivesite ya Princeton ku United States ndi yunivesite ya Uppsala ku Sweden adanena kuti mitundu yatsopanoyi inasintha m'mibadwo iwiri yokha, ngakhale kuti njirayi idakhulupirira kuti zimatenga nthawi yayitali, chifukwa cha kuswana pakati pa Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, ndi cactus finch yosamukira, Geospiza conirostris.

en: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
ny: Golide angagwiritsidwe ntchito mu mitundu yonse ya mawonekedwe. Ikhoza kugubuduzidwa kukhala mawonekedwe ang'onoang'ono.

en: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.
ny: Ikhoza kukokedwa mu waya woonda, womwe ukhoza kupotozedwa ndi kukopedwa. Ikhoza kumenyedwa kapena kugubuduzidwa m'mapepala.

en: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts".
ny: Ikhoza kupangidwa kukhala yowonda kwambiri, ndikumangika pachitsulo china. Ikhoza kupangidwa kukhala yowonda kwambiri moti nthawi zina inkagwiritsidwa ntchito kukongoletsa zithunzi zojambulidwa pamanja m'mabuku otchedwa "zolemba pamanja zowunikira".

en: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.
ny: Izi zimatchedwa pH ya mankhwala. Mukhoza kupanga chizindikiro pogwiritsa ntchito madzi ofiira a kabichi.

en: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.
ny: Madzi a kabichi amasintha mtundu malinga ndi momwe acidic kapena basic (alkaline) mankhwalawa alili.

en: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
ny: Mlingo wa pH umawonetsedwa ndi kuchuluka kwa hydrogen (H mu pH) ions mu mankhwala oyesedwa.

en: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ny: Ma ions a hydrogen ndi mapulotoni omwe anali ndi ma electron awo omwe anawachotsa (popeza maatomu a Hydrogen ali ndi proton imodzi ndi electron imodzi).

en: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.
ny: Swirl awiri youma ufa pamodzi ndiyeno, ndi manja oyera yonyowa, kukanikiza iwo mu mpira.

en: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.
ny: Chinyezi pa manja anu chidzachitapo kanthu ndi zigawo zakunja, zomwe zidzamva zoseketsa ndikupanga mtundu wa chipolopolo.

en: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.
ny: Mizinda ya Harappa ndi Mohenjo-daro inali ndi chimbudzi cha flush pafupifupi nyumba iliyonse, yophatikizidwa ndi dongosolo lapamwamba la zonyansa.

en: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
ny: Zotsalira za njira zotayira zinyalala zapezeka m'nyumba za mizinda ya Minoan ya Crete ndi Santorini ku Greece.

en: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
ny: Panalinso zimbudzi ku Iguputo wakale, Perisiya ndi China. M'chitukuko cha Aroma, zimbudzi nthaŵi zina zinali mbali ya nyumba zosambira za anthu onse kumene amuna ndi akazi anali pamodzi m'magulu osakanikirana.

en: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.
ny: Mukamaimbira foni munthu yemwe ali pamtunda wa makilomita zikwizikwi, mukugwiritsa ntchito satellite.

en: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.
ny: Satelite yomwe ili mumlengalenga imaitanidwa ndipo kenako imaiwonetsanso pansi, pafupifupi nthawi yomweyo.

en: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.
ny: Satelite inatumizidwa mumlengalenga ndi roketi. Asayansi amagwiritsa ntchito ma telescope mumlengalenga chifukwa mlengalenga wa Dziko lapansi umapotoza kuwala kwathu ndi mawonekedwe athu ena.

en: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
ny: Zimatengera roketi yaikulu pamtunda wa mamita 100 kuti iike satellite kapena telescope mumlengalenga.

en: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.
ny: Gudumu lasintha dziko m'njira zosaneneka. Chinthu chachikulu chomwe gudumu latichitira chimatipatsa mayendedwe osavuta kwambiri komanso othamanga.

en: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.
ny: Zatibweretsera sitima, galimoto, ndi zipangizo zina zambiri zoyendera.

en: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.
ny: Pansi pawo pali amphaka ambiri apakati amene amadya nyama zazikulu zapakati kuyambira akalulu mpaka antelopes ndi deer.

en: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.
ny: Pomalizira pake, pali amphaka ang'onoang'ono ambiri (kuphatikizapo amphaka a ziweto zotayirira) amene amadya nyama zazing'ono zambiri monga tizilombo, makoswe, abuluzi, ndi mbalame.

en: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
ny: Chinsinsi cha kupambana kwawo ndi lingaliro la niche, ntchito yapadera yomwe mphaka aliyense amagwira yomwe imapangitsa kuti asapikisane ndi ena.

en: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.
ny: Mikango ndi amphaka ochezera kwambiri, okhala m'magulu akuluakulu otchedwa kunyada.

en: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
ny: Kunyada kumapangidwa ndi mwamuna mmodzi kapena atatu achikulire ogwirizana, pamodzi ndi akazi ndi ana makumi atatu.

en: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.
ny: Kaŵirikaŵiri akazi amakhala ogwirizana kwambiri, pokhala banja lalikulu la alongo ndi ana aakazi.

en: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
ny: Mkango kunyada kuchita kwambiri ngati mapaketi a mimbulu kapena agalu, nyama modabwitsa ofanana ndi mikango (koma osati amphaka ena akuluakulu) mu khalidwe, komanso wakupha kwambiri nyama yawo.

en: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.
ny: Wothamanga wozungulira bwino, tiger amatha kukwera (ngakhale kuti si bwino), kusambira, kudumpha mtunda waukulu ndi kukoka ndi mphamvu kasanu mphamvu ya munthu wamphamvu.

en: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
ny: Nyalugwe ali m'gulu limodzi (Genus Panthera) monga mikango, anyalugwe, ndi jaguars. Mphaka anayi amenewa ndi okhawo amene angathe kubangula.

en: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
ny: Mkokomo wa nyalugwe suli ngati mkokomo wa mawu onse wa mkango, koma mofanana kwambiri ndi chiganizo cha mawu a snarly, ofuula.

en: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
ny: Ocelots amakonda kudya nyama zazing'ono. Adzagwira anyani, njoka, makoswe ndi mbalame ngati angathe. Pafupifupi nyama zonse zomwe zimasaka ocelot ndizochepa kwambiri kuposa momwe zilili.

en: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
ny: Asayansi amaganiza kuti ocelots amatsatira ndi kupeza nyama kudya (nyama) ndi fungo, kununkhiza kwa kumene iwo akhala pansi.

en: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
ny: Iwo akhoza kuona bwino kwambiri mu mdima ndi masomphenya usiku, ndi kuyenda mobisa kwambiri, kwambiri. Ocelots amasaka nyama yawo mwa kugwirizana ndi malo awo ozungulira kenako amaponya nyama yawo.

en: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
ny: Pamene gulu laling'ono la zinthu zamoyo (anthu ochepa) amalekanitsidwa ndi anthu ambiri omwe anachokera (monga ngati amayenda pamwamba pa mapiri kapena mtsinje, kapena ngati asamukira ku chilumba chatsopano kuti asathe kubwerera mosavuta) nthawi zambiri amapezeka kuti ali m'malo osiyana ndi momwe analili kale.

en: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
ny: Malo atsopanowa ali ndi chuma chosiyana ndi mpikisano wosiyana, kotero anthu atsopano adzafunikira zinthu zosiyanasiyana kapena kusintha kuti akhale mpikisano wamphamvu kuposa zomwe adafunikira kale.

en: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
ny: Chiwerengero choyambirira cha anthu sichinasinthe konse, amafunikirabe kusintha kofanana ndi kale.

en: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
ny: M'kupita kwa nthaŵi, pamene anthu atsopanowo ayamba kusinthira ku malo awo atsopano, amayamba kuoneka pang'ono mofanana ndi anthu ena.

en: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
ny: Potsirizira pake, pambuyo pa zaka zikwi kapena ngakhale mamiliyoni ambiri, anthu awiriwa adzawoneka osiyana kwambiri moti sangatchedwe mtundu umodzi.

en: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ny: Timatcha ndondomekoyi speciation, zomwe zimangotanthauza mapangidwe a mitundu yatsopano. Speciation ndi zotsatira zosapeweka komanso mbali yofunika kwambiri ya chisinthiko.

en: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
ny: Zomera zimapanga okosijeni yomwe anthu amapuma, ndipo amatenga carbon-dioxide yomwe anthu amapuma (ndiko kuti, kupuma kunja).

en: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
ny: Zomera zimapanga chakudya chawo kuchokera ku dzuwa ndi photosynthesis. Amaperekanso mthunzi.

en: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ny: Timapanga nyumba zathu kuchokera ku zomera ndikupanga zovala kuchokera ku zomera. Zakudya zambiri zomwe timadya ndi zomera. Popanda zomera, nyama sizinathe kukhala ndi moyo.

en: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
ny: Mosasaurus anali nyama yaikulu kwambiri m'nthaŵi yake, chotero sanaope kanthu, kupatulapo mosasaurs ena.

en: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
ny: Nsagwada zake zazitali zinali ndi mano oposa 70 akuthwa ngati lumo, pamodzi ndi zowonjezera zowonjezera padenga la pakamwa pake, kutanthauza kuti panalibe kuthawa kwa chilichonse chomwe chinadutsa njira yake.

en: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
ny: Sitikudziwa bwinobwino, koma mwina linali ndi lilime la forked. Zakudya zake zinaphatikizapo nkhasi, nsomba zazikulu, mosasaurs zina, ndipo mwina zinali zodya anthu.

en: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
ny: Inaukiranso chilichonse chomwe chinalowa m'madzi; ngakhale dinosaur yaikulu monga T. rex siingafanane nayo.

en: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
ny: Pamene kuli kwakuti chakudya chawo chochuluka chikakhala chozoloŵereka kwa ife, Aroma anali ndi mbali yawo ya zinthu zachilendo kapena zachilendo za phwando, kuphatikizapo nkhumba zakutchire, peacock, nkhono, ndi mtundu wa rodent wotchedwa dormouse

en: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
ny: Kusiyana kwina kunali kwakuti pamene kuli kwakuti anthu osauka ndi mkaziyo ankadya chakudya chawo pamene anali kukhala pamipando, amuna olemerawo ankakonda kukhala ndi mapwando pamodzi kumene anali kukhala m'mbali mwawo pamene anali kudya chakudya chawo.

en: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
ny: Chakudya chakale cha Aroma sichikanatha kuphatikizapo zakudya zomwe zinabwera ku Ulaya kuchokera ku America kapena ku Asia m'zaka mazana ambiri pambuyo pake.

en: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, iwo analibe chimanga, kapena tomato, kapena mbatata, kapena koko, ndipo palibe Aroma akale amene analawapo Turkey.

en: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
ny: Ababulo anamanga aliyense wa milungu yawo kachisi woyambirira amene analingaliridwa kukhala kwawo kwa mulungu.

en: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
ny: Anthu ankabweretsa nsembe kwa milungu ndipo ansembe ankayesa kusamalira zosowa za milungu kudzera m'miyambo ndi zikondwerero.

en: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
ny: Kachisi aliyense anali ndi bwalo lotseguka la kachisi ndipo kenaka malo opatulika amkati amene ansembe okha ndiwo anali kuloŵamo.

en: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
ny: Nthaŵi zina nsanja zapadera zopangidwa ndi piramidi, zotchedwa ziggurats, zinamangidwa kukhala mbali ya akachisi.

en: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
ny: Pamwamba pa nsanjayo panali malo opatulika apadera a mulungu.

en: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
ny: M'nyengo yotentha ya ku Middle East, nyumbayo sinali yofunika kwambiri.

en: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
ny: Moyo wambiri wa banja lachihebri unachitika pabwalo.

en: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
ny: Akazi anachita kuphika pabwalo; masitolo anali chabe ma counter otseguka akuyang'ana mumsewu. Mwala unagwiritsidwa ntchito pomanga nyumba.

en: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
ny: M'dziko la Kanani munalibe nkhalango zazikulu, choncho nkhuni zinali zodula kwambiri.

en: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
ny: Greenland inakhazikika pang'onopang'ono. Mu sagas a Norse iwo amanena kuti Erik the Red anathamangitsidwa ku Iceland chifukwa cha kupha, ndipo pamene anali kuyenda kumadzulo, anapeza Greenland ndipo anaitcha Greenland.

en: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
ny: Koma mosasamala kanthu za kupezeka kwake, mafuko a Eskimo anali kale kukhala kumeneko panthaŵiyo.

en: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ny: Ngakhale kuti dziko lililonse linali 'Scandinavian', panali kusiyana kwakukulu pakati pa anthu, mafumu, miyambo ndi mbiri ya Denmark, Sweden, Norway ndi Iceland.

en: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
ny: Ngati mwaonera filimu ya National Treasure, mungaganize kuti mapu a chuma analembedwa kumbuyo kwa Declaration of Independence.

en: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
ny: Komabe, zimenezo si zoona. Ngakhale kuti pali chinachake cholembedwa kumbuyo kwa chikalatacho, si mapu a chuma.

en: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
ny: Wolembedwa kumbuyo kwa Chilengezo cha Ufulu Wodzilamulira anali mawu akuti "Chilengezo Choyambirira cha Ufulu Wodzilamulira cha 4th July 1776". Lembali likuwonekera pansi pa chikalatacho, pansi.

en: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.
ny: Ngakhale palibe amene akudziwa motsimikiza amene analemba izo, zimadziwika kuti kumayambiriro kwa moyo wake, chikalata chachikulu cha zikopa (chimayeza 293/4 mainchesi ndi 241/2 mainchesi) chinagubuduzidwa kuti chisungidwe.

en: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
ny: Choncho, zikuoneka kuti notation anawonjezera chabe monga chizindikiro.

en: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
ny: Kutsika kwa D-Day ndi nkhondo zotsatirazi zinamasula kumpoto kwa France, koma kum'mwera sikunali kwaulere.

en: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
ny: Inalamulidwa ndi "Vichy" French. Awa anali anthu a ku France amene anapanga mtendere ndi Ajeremani mu 1940 ndipo anagwira ntchito ndi olandawo m'malo molimbana nawo.

en: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".
ny: Pa 15 August 1940, Magulu Ogwirizana anaukira kum'mwera kwa France, kuwukira kunatchedwa "Operation Dragoon".

en: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
ny: M'milungu iŵiri yokha asilikali a ku America ndi a Free French anamasula kummwera kwa France ndipo anali kutembenukira ku Germany.

en: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
ny: Chitukuko ndi chikhalidwe chimodzi chogawidwa ndi gulu lalikulu lalikulu la anthu omwe amakhala ndikugwira ntchito mogwirizana, chikhalidwe.

en: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
ny: Mawu akuti chitukuko amachokera ku Latin civilis, kutanthauza civil, zokhudzana ndi Latin civis, kutanthauza nzika, ndi civitas, kutanthauza mzinda kapena mzinda-boma, komanso zomwe mwanjira inayake zimafotokoza kukula kwa anthu.

en: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
ny: Mzinda-maboma ndiwo chiyambi cha mitundu. Chikhalidwe cha chitukuko chimatanthauza kupititsa patsogolo chidziwitso m'mibadwo ingapo, chikhalidwe chotsalira ndi kufalitsa mwachilungamo.

en: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
ny: Zikhalidwe zazing'ono nthawi zambiri zimazimiririka popanda kusiya umboni woyenera wa mbiri yakale ndipo zimalephera kuzindikiridwa ngati zikhalidwe zoyenera.

en: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
ny: Panthawi ya Nkhondo ya Revolutionary, mayiko khumi ndi atatu anayamba kupanga boma lofooka lapakati-ndi Congress kukhala gawo lake lokha-pansi pa Articles of Confederation.

en: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
ny: Nyumba ya Malamulo inalibe mphamvu iliyonse yopereka misonkho, ndipo, chifukwa chakuti panalibe mtsogoleri wa dziko kapena oweruza, inadalira akuluakulu a boma, omwe nthawi zambiri anali osagwirizana, kuti akhazikitse zochita zake zonse.

en: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
ny: Inalinsobe ulamuliro wogonjetsa malamulo a msonkho ndi mitengo pakati pa maboma.

en: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
ny: Nkhanizo zinafuna chilolezo chogwirizana kuchokera m'maboma onse zisanasinthe ndipo maboma anatenga boma lapakati mopepuka kwambiri moti oimira awo nthawi zambiri sanalipo.

en: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.
ny: Mpira wa dziko la Italy, pamodzi ndi timu ya mpira wa dziko la Germany ndi gulu lachiwiri lopambana kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi ndipo anali akatswiri a FIFA World Cup mu 2006.

en: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.
ny: Masewera otchuka amaphatikizapo mpira, basketball, volleyball, madzi-polo, mpanda, rugby, kupalasa njinga, ice hockey, roller hockey ndi F1 galimoto yothamanga.

en: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
ny: Masewera a chisanu ndi otchuka kwambiri m'madera akumpoto, ndi anthu a ku Italy akupikisana mu masewera apadziko lonse ndi zochitika za Olimpiki.

en: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
ny: Japans ili ndi zilumba pafupifupi 7,000 (chachikulu koposa kukhala Honshu), kupanga Japan kukhala chisumbu chachikulu cha 7 padziko lonse!

en: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"
ny: Chifukwa cha gulu / gulu la zilumba zomwe Japan ili nazo, Japan nthawi zambiri imatchulidwa, pa kaimidwe ka malo, monga "archipelago"

en: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
ny: Taiwan kuyambira kale m'zaka za zana la 15 kumene amalinyero a ku Ulaya omwe akudutsa amalemba dzina la chilumbachi monga Ilha Formosa, kapena chilumba chokongola.

en: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
ny: Mu 1624,Dutch East India Company imakhazikitsa maziko kum'mwera chakumadzulo kwa Taiwan, kuyambitsa kusintha kwa njira zopangira tirigu wa aborigine ndikugwiritsa ntchito antchito aku China kuti agwire ntchito pa minda yake ya mpunga ndi shuga.

en: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
ny: Mu 1683, magulu ankhondo a Qing dynasty (1644-1912) akulamulira madera a kumadzulo ndi kumpoto kwa gombe la Taiwan ndipo analengeza Taiwan kukhala chigawo cha Ufumu wa Qing mu 1885.

en: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
ny: Mu 1895, atagonjetsedwa mu Nkhondo Yoyamba ya Sino-Japan (1894-1895), boma la Qing linasaina Pangano la Shimonoseki, lomwe likupereka ulamuliro pa Taiwan ku Japan, yomwe ikulamulira chilumbachi mpaka 1945.

en: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
ny: Machu Picchu ili ndi nyumba zitatu zazikulu, zomwe ndi Intihuatana, Kachisi wa Dzuwa, ndi Chipinda cha Mawindo Atatu.

en: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
ny: Nyumba zambiri zomwe zili m'mphepete mwa nyumbayi zamangidwanso n'cholinga choti alendo odzaona malo adziwe bwino mmene zinaonekera poyamba.

en: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
ny: Pofika mu 1976, Machu Picchu makumi atatu pa 100 alionse anali atabwezeretsedwa ndipo kubwezeretsa kukupitirizabe mpaka lero.

en: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, ambiri akadali chithunzi kujambula mtundu mu dziko ndi 35mm, amene anali amphamvu filimu kukula kumapeto kwa nyengo analogi filimu.

en: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
ny: Iwo akadali opangidwa lero, koma chofunika kwambiri mbali yake chiŵerengero wakhala cholowa ndi digito kamera chithunzi kachipangizo mawonekedwe.

en: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
ny: Mtundu wa 35mm kwenikweni, pang'ono mosokoneza, 36mm m'lifupi ndi 24mm mu msinkhu.

en: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
ny: Chiwerengero cha mbali ya mawonekedwe awa (kugawidwa ndi khumi ndi awiri kuti apeze chiwerengero chosavuta cha chiwerengero chonse) chifukwa chake akuti ndi 3: 2.

en: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
ny: Mawonekedwe ambiri ofala (APS banja la mawonekedwe, mwachitsanzo) ndi ofanana kapena pafupifupi mbali imeneyi.

en: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
ny: Lamulo logwiritsidwa ntchito molakwika kwambiri komanso lonyozedwa nthawi zambiri lachitatu ndi chitsogozo chosavuta chopanga mphamvu pamene mukusunga muyeso wa dongosolo mu chithunzi.

en: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
ny: Limanena kuti malo ogwira mtima kwambiri pa nkhani yaikulu ndi pa mphambano ya mizere yogawa chithunzicho kukhala magawo atatu vertically ndi yopingasa (onani chitsanzo).

en: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
ny: M'nyengo imeneyi ya mbiri ya ku Ulaya, Tchalitchi cha Katolika, chimene chinakhala cholemera ndi champhamvu, chinayang'aniridwa.

en: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
ny: Kwa zaka zoposa chikwi chimodzi chipembedzo chachikristu chinagwirizanitsa maboma a ku Ulaya mosasamala kanthu za kusiyana kwa chinenero ndi miyambo. I

en: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
ny: Mphamvu zake zonse zomwe zinafalikira zinakhudza aliyense kuyambira mfumu mpaka wamba.

en: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
ny: Chimodzi mwa mfundo zazikulu zachikristu ndi chakuti chuma chiyenera kugwiritsidwa ntchito kuchepetsa kuvutika ndi umphawi komanso kuti ndalama za tchalitchi zilipo makamaka pa chifukwa chimenecho.

en: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
ny: Ulamuliro wapakati wa tchalitchi unali ku Roma kwa zaka zoposa chikwi chimodzi ndipo kugwirizana kwa mphamvu ndi ndalama kumeneku kunapangitsa ambiri kukayikira ngati mfundo imeneyi ikukwaniritsidwa.

en: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
ny: Nkhondo itangobuka, dziko la Britain linayambitsa chitseko cha asilikali apanyanja ku Germany.

en: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
ny: Njirayi inatsimikizira kukhala yogwira mtima, kudula katundu wofunika kwambiri wa asilikali ndi anthu wamba, ngakhale kuti kutsekedwa kumeneku kunaphwanya malamulo ovomerezeka apadziko lonse omwe analembedwa ndi mapangano angapo apadziko lonse a zaka mazana awiri zapitazi.

en: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
ny: Dziko la Britain linakumba madzi a padziko lonse pofuna kuletsa zombo zilizonse kulowa m'zigawo zonse za nyanja, zomwe zinachititsa kuti zombo zisaloŵe m'ndale.

en: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ny: Popeza kuti panali chivomerezo chochepa pa njira imeneyi, Germany anayembekezera kuyankha kofananako ku nkhondo yake ya m'madzi yopanda malire.

en: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
ny: M'zaka za m'ma 1920, maganizo ofala a nzika zambiri ndi mitundu anali a pacifism ndi kudzipatula.

en: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
ny: Pambuyo poona zoopsa ndi nkhanza za nkhondo mkati mwa Nkhondo Yadziko I, mitundu inakhumba kupeŵa mkhalidwe woterowo mtsogolo.

en: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
ny: Mu 1884, Tesla anasamukira ku United States of America kukalandira ntchito ku Edison Company ku New York City.

en: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
ny: Anafika ku US ndi masenti 4 ku dzina lake, buku la ndakatulo, ndi kalata yovomerezeka kuchokera kwa Charles Batchelor (manejala wake pantchito yake yapitayi) kwa Thomas Edison.

en: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
ny: China wakale anali ndi njira yapadera yowonetsera nthawi zosiyanasiyana; gawo lililonse la China kapena banja lililonse lomwe linali kulamulira linali ufumu wapadera.

en: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
ny: Komanso pakati pa ufumu uliwonse panali nyengo yosakhazikika ya zigawo zogawanika. Chomwe chimadziwika kwambiri pa nthawi imeneyi chinali nyengo ya maufumu atatu yomwe inkachitika kwa zaka 60 pakati pa Han ndi Jin Dynasty.

en: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
ny: M'nyengo zimenezi nkhondo yoopsa inachitika pakati pa anthu ambiri olemekezeka amene anali kumenyera mpando wachifumu.

en: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
ny: Maufumu Atatuwo anali amodzi mwa nyengo zokhetsa magazi kwambiri m'mbiri ya Ancient China anthu zikwizikwi anafa akulimbana kuti akhale pampando wapamwamba kwambiri m'nyumba yaikulu yachifumu ku Xi'an.

en: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
ny: Pali zotsatira zambiri za chikhalidwe ndi ndale monga kugwiritsa ntchito dongosolo la metric, kusintha kuchokera ku absolutism kupita ku republicanism, utundu ndi chikhulupiriro chakuti dziko ndi la anthu osati kwa wolamulira mmodzi yekha.

en: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
ny: Komanso pambuyo pa ntchito za Revolution zinali zotseguka kwa onse ofunsira amuna kulola ofuna kwambiri komanso opambana kuti apambane.

en: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
ny: Yemweyo amapita kwa asilikali chifukwa m'malo asilikali rankings kukhala zochokera kalasi iwo tsopano zochokera cailaber.

en: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
ny: Kusintha kwa ku France kunasonkhezeranso anthu ena ambiri oponderezedwa ogwira ntchito a m'dziko lina kuyamba kusintha kwawo.

en: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.
ny: Muhammad anali wokondweretsedwa kwambiri ndi nkhani zoposa moyo wamba umenewu. Ankakonda kupita pafupipafupi ku phanga lomwe linayamba kudziwika kuti "Hira'" pa Phiri la "Noor" (kuwala) chifukwa chosinkhasinkha.

en: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.
ny: iye amagwa yekha, zomwe zinapulumuka nthawi, zimapereka chithunzi chowonekera kwambiri cha zikhoterero zauzimu za Muhammad.

en: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
ny: Popuma pamwamba pa phiri limodzi kumpoto kwa Mecca, phangalo lili kutali kotheratu ndi dziko lonse.

en: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
ny: Ndipotu n'zovuta kupeza ngakhale munthu atadziwa kuti alipo. Akalowa m'phanga, ndi kudzipatula kwathunthu.

en: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ny: Palibe chimene chingawonedwe kusiyapo thambo loyera, lokongola pamwamba ndi mapiri ambiri ozungulira. Zochepa kwambiri za dzikoli zikhoza kuwonedwa kapena kumveka kuchokera mkati mwa phanga.

en: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
ny: Piramidi Yaikulu ku Giza ndi imodzi yokha mwa zodabwitsa zisanu ndi ziwiri zomwe zikuyimirabe lero.

en: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
ny: Yomangidwa ndi Aigupto m'zaka za zana lachitatu BCE, Piramidi Yaikulu ndi imodzi mwazinthu zambiri zazikulu za piramidi zomangidwa kuti zilemekeze Farao wakufa.

en: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
ny: Giza Plateau, kapena "Giza Necropolis" ku Chigwa cha Aigupto cha Akufa ili ndi mapiramidi angapo (omwe piramidi yayikulu ndi yaikulu kwambiri), manda angapo ang'onoang'ono, akachisi angapo, ndi Sphinx yaikulu.

en: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
ny: Piramidi yaikulu inalengedwa kuti ilemekeze Farao Khufu, ndipo mapiramidi ang'onoang'ono ambiri, manda, ndi akachisi anamangidwa kuti alemekeze akazi a Khufu ndi anthu a m'banja lake.

en: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
ny: Chizindikiro cha "uta wa mmwamba" chikuwoneka ngati V ndi "chizindikiro cha uta pansi" ngati chofunika kwambiri kapena lalikulu losowa mbali yake yapansi.

en: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
ny: Mmwamba zikutanthauza muyenera kuyamba pa nsonga ndi kukankhira uta, ndipo pansi zikutanthauza muyenera kuyamba pa mbozi (amene ali kumene dzanja lanu likugwira uta) ndi kukoka uta.

en: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.
ny: An mmwamba-uta nthawi zambiri amapanga phokoso zofewa, pamene pansi-uta ndi amphamvu ndi assertive kwambiri.

en: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.
ny: Khalani omasuka pensulo mu zizindikiro zanu, koma kumbukirani zizindikiro zosindikizidwa za uta zilipo chifukwa cha nyimbo, kotero nthawi zambiri ziyenera kulemekezedwa.

en: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
ny: Mfumu Louis XVI yowopsa, Mfumukazi Marie Antoinette ana awo awiri aang'ono (Marie Therese wazaka 11 ndi Louis-Charles wazaka zinayi) ndi mlongo wa Mfumu, Madam Elizabeth, pa 6th October 1789 adakakamizidwa kubwerera ku Paris kuchokera ku Versailles ndi gulu la akazi a msika.

en: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
ny: M'ngolo, iwo anabwerera ku Paris atazunguliridwa ndi gulu la anthu akufuula ndi kufuula moopseza Mfumu ndi Mfumukazi.

en: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.
ny: Gulu la anthu linakakamiza Mfumu Ndi Mfumukazi kukhala ndi mawindo awo a ngolo otseguka kwambiri.

en: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
ny: Panthaŵi ina chiŵalo cha gululo chinagwedeza mutu wa mlonda wachifumu amene anaphedwa ku Versailles pamaso pa Mfumukazi yowopsayo.

en: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.
ny: Ndalama zowonongedwa pankhondo za ulamuliro wa United States m'kugonjetsa Philippines zinalipiridwa ndi anthu a ku Philippines enieniwo.

en: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.
ny: Iwo anakakamizika kupereka misonkho ku boma la atsamunda la United States kuti alipire gawo lalikulu la ndalama zowonongedwa ndipo chiwongoladzanja cha ma bond chinayandama m'dzina la boma la Philippines kudzera m'nyumba za banki za Wall Street.

en: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
ny: Ndithudi, ma superprofit otengedwa kuchokera ku kudyeredwa masuku pamutu kwa nthaŵi yaitali kwa anthu a ku Philippines akakhala mapindu aakulu a ulamuliro wa United States.

en: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.
ny: Kuti mumvetse Templars munthu ayenera kumvetsetsa nkhani yomwe inachititsa kulengedwa kwa dongosolo.

en: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).
ny: Msinkhu umene zochitikazo zinachitika nthawi zambiri umatchedwa High Middle Ages nthawi ya mbiri ya ku Ulaya m'zaka za zana la 11, 12, ndi 13 (AD 1000-1300).

en: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
ny: Nyengo Zapamwamba Zapakati zinayambitsidwa ndi Nyengo Zapakati Zoyambirira ndipo zinatsatiridwa ndi Late Middle Ages, yomwe pofika msonkhano imathera cha m'ma 1500.

en: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
ny: Zotsimikizira zamakono ndi mawu omwe amaphatikizapo malingaliro osiyanasiyana omwe akugwira ntchito, kuchokera ku teknoloji-kukankha kapena zofunikira zamakono mpaka lingaliro lokhwima kuti tsogolo la anthu limayendetsedwa ndi mfundo zomwe zimagwirizana ndi malamulo asayansi ndi kuwonetsera kwawo mu teknoloji.

en: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
ny: Kutanthauzira kwambiri kwa determinism yamakono kumagawana malingaliro awiri ambiri: kuti chitukuko cha teknoloji palokha chimatsatira njira makamaka kupitirira chikhalidwe kapena chisonkhezero cha ndale, ndikuti luso nalonso limakhala ndi "zotsatira" pa mabungwe omwe ali ndi chibadwa, osati chikhalidwe cha anthu.

en: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, wina anganene kuti galimoto ya galimoto imatsogolera ku chitukuko cha misewu.

en: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
ny: Komabe, msewu wa m'dziko lonselo suli wogwira ntchito m'zachuma kwa magalimoto ochepa chabe, choncho njira zatsopano zopangira zimapangidwa kuchepetsa mtengo wa umwini wa galimoto.

en: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
ny: Kukhala ndi magalimoto ambiri kumayambitsanso kuchuluka kwa ngozi m'misewu, zomwe zimapangitsa kuti pakhale njira zatsopano zothandizira zaumoyo pokonza mitembo yowonongeka.

en: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
ny: Kukondana kunali ndi mbali yaikulu ya chikhalidwe cha chikhalidwe, chochokera kwa olemba monga Goethe, Fichte, ndi Schlegel.

en: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
ny: M'nkhani ya Romanticism, malo a geograph anaumba anthu, ndipo m'kupita kwa nthaŵi miyambo ndi chikhalidwe chokhudzana ndi malo amenewo zinabuka, ndipo izi, pokhala zogwirizana ndi malo a chitaganya, zinali zabwino kuposa malamulo oikidwa mwachisawawa.

en: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
ny: M'njira imene Paris amadziŵika monga likulu la mafashoni la dziko lamakono, Constantinople analingaliridwa kukhala likulu la mafashoni la Ulaya wa feudal.

en: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
ny: Kutchuka kwake chifukwa chokhala chimake cha mwanaalirenji kunayamba pafupifupi 400 AD ndipo kunatenga mpaka pafupifupi 1100 AD.

en: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
ny: Mkhalidwe wake unatsika m'zaka za zana la khumi ndi ziwiri makamaka chifukwa chakuti a Crusaders anabwerera atanyamula mphatso monga silika ndi zonunkhira zomwe zinali zofunika kwambiri kuposa zomwe misika ya Byzantine inapereka.

en: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
ny: Pa nthawiyi ndi pamene kusamutsidwa kwa mutu wa Fashion Capital kuchokera ku Constantinople kupita ku Paris kunapangidwa.

en: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
ny: Kalembedwe ka Gothic kanafika pachimake m'nyengo ya pakati pa zaka za zana la 10 - 11 ndi zaka za zana la 14.

en: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
ny: Poyamba kavalidwe kanasonkhezeredwa kwambiri ndi chikhalidwe cha Byzantine kum'mawa.

en: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
ny: Komabe, chifukwa cha njira zolankhulirana pang'onopang'ono, masitaelo kumadzulo akhoza kukhala kumbuyo ndi chaka cha 25 mpaka 30.

en: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
ny: chakumapeto kwa Nyengo Zapakati kumadzulo kwa Ulaya anayamba kukulitsa kalembedwe kawo. chimodzi mwa zochitika zazikulu za nthawiyo chifukwa cha nkhondo za mtanda anthu anayamba kugwiritsa ntchito mabatani kumanga zovala.

en: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
ny: Ulimi wa chakudya ndi ulimi womwe umachitika popanga chakudya chokwanira kuti akwaniritse zosowa za ulimi ndi banja lake.

en: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
ny: Ulimi wa chakudya ndi njira yosavuta, nthawi zambiri ya organic, pogwiritsa ntchito mbewu yopulumutsidwa yachibadwidwe ku ecoregion kuphatikiza ndi kusinthasintha kwa mbewu kapena njira zina zosavuta kuti ziwonjezere zokolola.

en: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
ny: M'mbiri yakale alimi ambiri anali kuchita ulimi wa chakudya ndipo izi zikuchitikabe m'mayiko ambiri osauka.

en: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
ny: Subcultures amabweretsa pamodzi anthu omwe ali ndi maganizo ofanana omwe amamva kuti akunyalanyazidwa ndi miyezo ya chikhalidwe ndikuwalola kukhala ndi lingaliro la kudziwika.

en: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
ny: Subcultures ikhoza kukhala yosiyana chifukwa cha zaka, fuko, kalasi, malo, ndi / kapena kugonana kwa mamembala.

en: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
ny: Mikhalidwe imene imasankha chikhalidwe chaing'ono kukhala chosiyana ingakhale chinenero, kukongola, chipembedzo, ndale zadziko, kugonana, malo, kapena kuphatikiza zinthu.

en: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
ny: Mamembala a subculture nthawi zambiri amasonyeza umembala wawo kudzera mu kugwiritsa ntchito kwapadera komanso kophiphiritsira kwa kalembedwe, komwe kumaphatikizapo mafashoni, mayendedwe, ndi argot.

en: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
ny: Imodzi mwa njira zofala kwambiri zomwe zimagwiritsidwa ntchito pofotokoza kufunika kwa kuyanjana ndi kugwiritsa ntchito milandu yochepa yomvetsa chisoni ya ana omwe anali, mwa kunyalanyaza, tsoka, kapena nkhanza zadala, osayanjana ndi akuluakulu pamene anali kukula.

en: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
ny: Ana oterewa amatchedwa "feral" kapena zakutchire. Ana ena a feral atsekeredwa ndi anthu (kawirikawiri makolo awo); nthawi zina kusiya mwana kumeneku kunali chifukwa chakuti makolo anakana kuti mwana ali ndi vuto lalikulu la nzeru kapena thupi.

en: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
ny: Ana a Feral angakhale atazunzidwa kwambiri ndi ana kapena kupwetekedwa mtima asanasiyidwe kapena kuthawa.

en: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
ny: Ena akuti analeredwa ndi nyama; ena akuti ankakhala kuthengo paokha.

en: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
ny: Pamene akuleredwa kwathunthu ndi nyama zosakhala zaumunthu, mwana wa feral amasonyeza makhalidwe (mkati mwa malire a thupi) pafupifupi kwathunthu ngati a chisamaliro chapadera-nyama, monga mantha ake kapena mphwayi kwa anthu.

en: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
ny: Ngakhale polojekiti zochokera kuphunzira ayenera kupanga kuphunzira mosavuta ndi chidwi kwambiri, scaffolding amapita sitepe kupitirira.

en: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
ny: Scaffolding si njira yophunzira koma m'malo mwake chithandizo chomwe chimapereka chithandizo kwa anthu omwe akuphunzira zatsopano monga kugwiritsa ntchito pulogalamu yatsopano ya kompyuta kapena kuyamba ntchito yatsopano.

en: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
ny: Scaffolds akhoza kukhala onse pafupifupi ndi weniweni, mwa mawu ena, mphunzitsi ndi mtundu wa scaffold koma momwemonso pang'ono paperclip munthu mu Microsoft Office.

en: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
ny: Pafupifupi Scaffolds ndi internalized mu mapulogalamu ndipo amatanthauza kukayikira, mwamsanga, ndi kufotokoza ndondomeko zimene zingakhale zovuta kwa wophunzira kusamalira yekha.

en: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
ny: Ana amaikidwa mu Foster Care pazifukwa zosiyanasiyana zomwe zimachokera ku kunyalanyaza, kuchitira nkhanza, ndipo ngakhale kulanda.

en: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
ny: Palibe mwana amene ayenera kukula m'malo amene sali kusamalira, kusamalira, ndi kuphunzitsa, koma amatero.

en: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
ny: Timaona kuti Foster Care System ndi malo otetezeka kwa ana awa.

en: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
ny: Dongosolo lathu losamalira ana limayenera kupereka nyumba zotetezeka, osamalira achikondi, maphunziro okhazikika, ndi chithandizo chaumoyo chodalirika.

en: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
ny: Chisamaliro cholera chikuyenera kupereka zofunikira zonse zomwe zinali zosowa m'nyumba yomwe adatengedwa kale.

en: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
ny: Intaneti imagwirizanitsa zinthu za kulankhulana kwa anthu ambiri komanso pakati pa anthu.

en: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
ny: Makhalidwe osiyana a intaneti amatsogolera ku miyeso yowonjezera malinga ndi njira yogwiritsira ntchito ndi kukhutira.

en: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
ny: Mwachitsanzo, "kuphunzira" ndi "kuyanjana" kumafotokozedwa ngati zolimbikitsa zofunika kwambiri pakugwiritsa ntchito intaneti (James et al., 1995) .

en: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
ny: "Kuphatikizidwa kwaumwini" ndi "maunansi opitilira" adadziwikanso ngati mbali zatsopano zolimbikitsa ndi Eighmey and McCord (1998) pamene adafufuza momwe omvera amachitira pa mawebusaiti.

en: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito kujambula kanema kwapangitsa kuti pakhale zofunikira zomwe zapezeka pakumasulira mawu aang'ono, kayendedwe ka nkhope komwe kumatha milliseconds ochepa.

en: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
ny: Makamaka, akuti munthu akhoza kuzindikira ngati munthu akunama mwa kumasulira mawu aang'ono molondola.

en: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
ny: Oliver Sacks, m'pepala lake The President's Speech, adawonetsa momwe anthu omwe sangathe kumvetsetsa kulankhula chifukwa cha kuwonongeka kwa ubongo komabe amatha kuwunika moona mtima molondola.

en: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ny: Iye mpaka akupereka lingaliro lakuti maluso oterowo m'kumasulira khalidwe la anthu angagawidwe ndi nyama zonga ngati agalu apakhomo.

en: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
ny: Kafukufuku wa m'zaka za zana la makumi awiri wasonyeza kuti pali maiwe awiri a kusiyana kwa majini: obisika ndi ofotokozedwa.

en: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
ny: Kusintha kumawonjezera kusiyana kwatsopano kwa majini, ndipo kusankha kumachotsa m'dziwe la kusiyana kofotokozedwa.

en: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
ny: Kupatukana ndi recombination shuffle kusiyana kumbuyo ndi kutsogolo pakati pa maiwe awiri ndi mbadwo uliwonse.

en: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
ny: Kunja kwa savanna, zimakhala zovuta kuti nyama yotchedwa primate yomwe ili ndi dongosolo la m'mimba ngati la anthu ikwaniritse zofunikira zake za amino-acid kuchokera ku zomera zomwe zilipo.

en: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
ny: Ndiponso, kulephera kuchita zimenezo kuli ndi zotulukapo zoopsa: kupsinjika maganizo kwa kukula, kupereŵera kwa zakudya m'thupi, ndipo potsirizira pake imfa.

en: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
ny: Zomera zomwe zimapezeka mosavuta zikanakhala mapuloteni omwe amapezeka m'masamba ndi legumes, koma izi zimakhala zovuta kwa anyani ngati ife kugaya pokhapokha ataphika.

en: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
ny: Mosiyana ndi izi, zakudya za nyama (nyerere, chiswe, mazira) sizimangokhala zosavuta kugaya, koma zimapereka mapuloteni ochuluka kwambiri omwe ali ndi ma amino acid onse ofunikira.

en: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
ny: Zinthu zonse zomwe zimaganiziridwa, sitiyenera kudabwa ngati makolo athu enieni anathetsa "vuto lawo la mapuloteni" mofanana ndi momwe chimps pa savanna amachitira lero.

en: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
ny: Kusokonezeka kwa tulo ndi njira yodzuka mwadala panthawi yanu yogona bwino ndikugona nthawi yochepa pambuyo pake (mphindi 10-60).

en: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
ny: Izi zikhoza kuchitidwa mosavuta pogwiritsa ntchito wotchi ya alamu yabata kuti mumvetsetse popanda kukudzutsa kwathunthu.

en: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
ny: Ngati mupeza kuti mukubwezeretsanso wotchi mu tulo tanu, ikhoza kuikidwa kumbali ina ya chipindacho, kukukakamizani kutuluka pabedi kuti muzizimitsa.

en: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
ny: Zosankha zina zopangidwa ndi biorhythm zimaphatikizapo kumwa madzi ambiri (makamaka madzi kapena tiyi, diuretic yodziwika) musanayambe kugona, kukakamiza munthu kudzuka kuti akodza.

en: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
ny: Kuchuluka kwa mtendere wa mumtima umene munthu ali nawo kumagwirizana mosiyana ndi kuchuluka kwa mavuto m'thupi ndi mzimu wa munthu.

en: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
ny: Pamene mavuto achepa, mphamvu ya moyo amakhala yabwino kwambiri. Munthu aliyense angathe kupeza mtendere weniweni ndi chikhutiro.

en: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
ny: Aliyense akhoza kukwaniritsa chidziwitso. Chinthu chokha chomwe chikuyimira m'njira ya cholinga ichi ndi mavuto athu ndi negativity.

en: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
ny: Chibuda cha Tibetan chimachokera ku ziphunzitso za Buddha, koma chinawonjezeredwa ndi njira ya mahayana ya chikondi komanso ndi njira zambiri kuchokera ku Indian Yoga.

en: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
ny: Mfundo yake Chibuda cha ku Tibet n'chophweka kwambiri. Imakhala ndi Kundalini Yoga, kusinkhasinkha ndi njira ya chikondi chokumbatira zonse.

en: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
ny: Ndi Kundalini Yoga mphamvu ya Kundalini (mphamvu yowunikira) imadzutsidwa kudzera mu makhalidwe a yoga, kupuma, mantras ndi kuwonetsera.

en: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
ny: Pakati pa kusinkhasinkha kwa Tibetan ndi Deity Yoga. Kupyolera mu kuwonetsera kwa milungu yosiyanasiyana njira za mphamvu zimayeretsedwa, chakras imayambitsidwa ndipo chidziwitso chowunikira chimalengedwa.

en: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
ny: Germany inali mdani wamba mu Nkhondo Yadziko 2, kutsogolera ku mgwirizano pakati pa USSR ndi USA. Ndi kutha kwa nkhondo kulimbana kwa dongosolo, ndondomeko ndi chikhalidwe zinachititsa maiko kugwa.

en: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
ny: Ndi zaka ziwiri za kutha kwa nkhondo, omwe kale anali ogwirizana tsopano anali adani ndipo Nkhondo ya Mawu inayamba.

en: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ny: Iyenera kukhala zaka 40 zotsatira ndipo idzamenyedwa kwenikweni, ndi magulu ankhondo a proxy, pamabwalo ankhondo kuchokera ku Africa kupita ku Asia, ku Afghanistan, Cuba ndi malo ena ambiri.

en: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
ny: Pofika pa September 17, 1939, chitetezo cha Poland chinali chitaswa kale, ndipo chiyembekezo chokha chinali kubwerera ndi kukonzanso m'mphepete mwa mlatho wa ku Romania.

en: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
ny: Komabe, mapulani amenewa anapangidwa kukhala achikale pafupifupi usiku umodzi, pamene asilikali oposa 800,000 ochokera ku Soviet Union Red Army analowa ndikupanga malo a Belarussian ndi Ukraine atalowerera m'madera a kum'mawa kwa Poland mosemphana ndi mgwirizano wa Riga Peace, Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, ndi mapangano ena apadziko lonse, onse awiri ndi ambiri.

en: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito zombo ponyamula katundu ndi njira yabwino kwambiri yosunthira anthu ambiri ndi katundu kudutsa nyanja.

en: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
ny: Ntchito ya navies yakhala ikuwonetsetsa kuti dziko lanu likusunga mphamvu yosunthira anthu anu ndi katundu, pamene nthawi yomweyo, kusokoneza mphamvu ya mdani wanu kusuntha anthu ake ndi katundu.

en: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
ny: Chimodzi mwa zitsanzo zaposachedwa kwambiri za izi chinali kampeni ya North Atlantic ya WWII. Anthu a ku America anali kuyesa kusamutsa amuna ndi zipangizo kudutsa nyanja ya Atlantic kuti athandize Britain.
