en: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
ny: Pa nthawi imodzimodziyo, asilikali apanyanja a ku Germany, pogwiritsa ntchito makamaka mabwato a U, anali kuyesa kuletsa magalimoto amenewa.

en: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
ny: Ngati mayiko ogwirizana akanalephera, mwina dziko la Germany likanatha kugonjetsa dziko la Britain ngati mmene linalili ndi mayiko ena onse a ku Ulaya.

en: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
ny: Zikuoneka kuti mbuzi zinayamba kuweta nyama pafupifupi zaka 10,000 zapitazo m'mapiri a Zagros ku Iran.

en: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
ny: Zikhalidwe ndi mafuko akale anayamba kuzisunga kuti zikhale zosavuta kupeza mkaka, tsitsi, nyama, ndi zikopa.

en: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
ny: Kaŵirikaŵiri mbuzi zoweta zinali kusungidwa m'magulu amene anali kuyendayenda m'mapiri kapena m'malo ena odyetserako ziweto, kaŵirikaŵiri osamalidwa ndi mbuzi zimene kaŵirikaŵiri zinali ana kapena achichepere, mofanana ndi mbusa wodziŵika kwambiri. Njira zimenezi za kukhazidwe zikugwiritsidwabe ntchito lerolino.

en: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
ny: Wagonways inamangidwa ku England kale kwambiri m'zaka za zana la 16.

en: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
ny: Ngakhale kuti njira za ngolo zinali chabe matabwa ofanana, iwo analola mahatchi kuwakoka kuti apeze liŵiro lalikulu ndi kukoka katundu wamkulu kuposa m'misewu yovuta pang'ono ya tsikulo.

en: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
ny: Crossties anayambitsa mwachilungamo oyambirira kugwira njanji m'malo. Komabe, pang'onopang'ono, zinazindikiridwa kuti njira zingakhale zogwira mtima kwambiri ngati zili ndi stip yachitsulo pamwamba.

en: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
ny: Zimenezi zinakhala zofala, koma chitsulocho chinapangitsa kuvala kwambiri mawilo a matabwa a ngolozo.

en: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
ny: Potsirizira pake, mawilo a matabwa analowedwa m'malo ndi mawilo achitsulo. Mu 1767, njanji zoyamba zachitsulo chokwanira zinayambitsidwa.

en: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
ny: Mayendedwe oyamba odziwika anali kuyenda, anthu anayamba kuyenda mowongoka zaka mamiliyoni awiri zapitazo ndi kutuluka kwa Homo Erectus (kutanthauza munthu wolunjika).

en: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
ny: Otsogolera awo, Australopithecus sanayende mowongoka monga mwachizolowezi.

en: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
ny: Bipedal specializations amapezeka Australopithecus zakale kuchokera zaka 4.2-3.9 miliyoni zapitazo, ngakhale Sahelanthropus mwina anayenda pa miyendo iwiri kale zaka mamiliyoni asanu ndi awiri zapitazo.

en: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
ny: Tikhoza kuyamba kukhala aubwenzi kwambiri ndi chilengedwe, tikhoza kujowina ku gulu la zachilengedwe, ndipo tikhoza ngakhale kukhala omenyera ufulu kuti tichepetse kuvutika kwamtsogolo pamlingo winawake.

en: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
ny: Izi zili ngati mankhwala a zizindikiro nthawi zambiri. Komabe, ngati sitikufuna njira yothetsera kwakanthawi, ndiye kuti tiyenera kupeza muzu wa mavuto, ndipo tiyenera kuwachotsa.

en: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
ny: N'zoonekeratu kuti dziko lasintha kwambiri chifukwa cha kupita patsogolo kwa sayansi ndi sayansi kwa anthu, ndipo mavuto akhala aakulu chifukwa cha kuchuluka kwa anthu ndi moyo wopambanitsa wa anthu.

en: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
ny: Pambuyo pa kutengedwa kwake ndi Congress pa Julayi 4, chikalata cholembedwa pamanja chosainidwa ndi Purezidenti wa Congress John Hancock ndi Mlembi Charles Thomson kenako chinatumizidwa kutali ndi nyumba zingapo ku shopu yosindikiza ya John Dunlap.

en: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
ny: Usiku wonse pakati pa makope a 150 ndi 200 adapangidwa, omwe tsopano amadziwika kuti "Dunlap broadsides".

en: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
ny: Kuwerenga koyamba kwa anthu onse kwa chikalatacho kunali kwa John Nixon pabwalo la Independence Hall pa July 8.

en: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
ny: Mmodzi anatumizidwa kwa George Washington pa July 6, amene anaŵerengera asilikali ake ku New York pa July 9. Kope linafika ku London pa August 10.

en: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
ny: The 25 Dunlap broadsides akadali kudziwika kuti alipo ndi makope akale opulumuka a chikalata. Kope loyambirira lolembedwa pamanja silinapulumuke.

en: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
ny: Akatswiri ambiri a zinthu zakale masiku ano amakhulupirira kuti gulu lina la madinosaur linapulumuka ndipo lili ndi moyo masiku ano. Timawatcha mbalame.

en: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
ny: Anthu ambiri samawaona ngati madinosaur chifukwa ali ndi nthenga ndipo amatha kuuluka.

en: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
ny: Koma pali zinthu zambiri zokhudza mbalame zomwe zikuwonekabe ngati dinosaur.

en: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
ny: Ali ndi mapazi okhala ndi mamba ndi zikhadabo, amaika mazira, ndipo amayenda pa miyendo yawo iwiri kumbuyo ngati T-Rex.

en: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
ny: Pafupifupi makompyuta onse omwe amagwiritsidwa ntchito masiku ano amachokera pakugwiritsa ntchito chidziwitso chomwe chima coded mu mawonekedwe a manambala a binary.

en: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
ny: Chiwerengero cha binary chikhoza kukhala ndi chimodzi chokha mwa makhalidwe awiri, mwachitsanzo 0 kapena 1, ndipo manambala awa amatchedwa manambala a binary - kapena zidutswa, kuti agwiritse ntchito jargon ya kompyuta.

en: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
ny: Poizoni wamkati sangaonekere nthawi yomweyo. Zizindikiro, monga kusanza n'zofala mokwanira moti munthu sangapezeke mwamsanga.

en: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
ny: Chizindikiro chabwino kwambiri cha poizoni wamkati chingakhale kukhalapo kwa chidebe chotseguka cha mankhwala kapena mankhwala a poizoni apanyumba.

en: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ny: Onani chizindikirocho kuti mupeze malangizo enieni othandizira oyambirira a poizoni wapadera ameneyo.

en: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
ny: Mawu akuti kachilombo amagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi akatswiri a tizilombo m'lingaliro lovomerezeka la gulu ili la tizilombo.

en: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
ny: Mawuwa amachokera ku chidziwitso chakale cha Bed-bugs, zomwe ndi tizilombo tosinthidwa kwambiri kuti tiwononge anthu.

en: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
ny: Onse Assassin-nsikidzi ndi Bedi-nsikidzi ndi nidicolous, kusinthidwa kukhala mu chisa kapena nyumba ya wolandira awo.

en: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
ny: Kuzungulira United States of America, pali pafupifupi odwala 400,000 odziŵika a Multiple Sclerosis (MS), akuisiya kukhala nthenda yotsogola ya mitsempha mwa achichepere ndi achikulire a zaka zapakati.

en: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
ny: MS ndi matenda omwe amakhudza dongosolo la mitsempha yapakati, yomwe imapangidwa ndi ubongo, msana ndi mitsempha ya maso.

en: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
ny: Kafukufuku wapeza kuti akazi amakhala ndi mwayi waukulu kuwirikiza kawiri kukhala ndi MS kenako amuna.

en: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
ny: Okwatirana angasankhe kuti sikuli kwabwino kwa iwo, kapena m'chikondwerero cha mwana wawo, kulera mwana.

en: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
ny: Okwatirana ameneŵa angasankhe kupanga makonzedwe a kulera mwana wawo.

en: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
ny: M'kulera ana, makolo obadwawo amathetsa ufulu wawo wa makolo kotero kuti okwatirana ena alere mwanayo.

en: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
ny: Cholinga chachikulu cha sayansi ndi kudziwa momwe dziko limagwirira ntchito kudzera mu njira ya sayansi. Njira imeneyi kwenikweni imatsogolera kafukufuku wambiri wa sayansi.

en: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
ny: Si yekha ngakhale, kuyesera, ndipo kuyesera ndi mayeso omwe amagwiritsidwa ntchito kuthetsa chimodzi kapena zingapo za malingaliro omwe angakhalepo, kufunsa mafunso, ndikupanga zowonera zimatsogoleranso kafukufuku wa sayansi.

en: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
ny: Akatswiri a zachilengedwe ndi afilosofi anasumika maganizo pa malemba akale ndipo, makamaka, pa Baibulo m'Chilatini.

en: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
ny: Zovomerezeka zinali malingaliro a Aristotle pa nkhani zonse za sayansi, kuphatikizapo psychology.

en: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
ny: Pamene chidziŵitso cha Agiriki chinatsika, maiko a Kumadzulo analekanitsidwa ndi mizu yake ya filosofi ndi sayansi yachigiriki.

en: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
ny: Njira zambiri zomwe zimawonedwa mu physiology ndi khalidwe nthawi zambiri zimadalira kwambiri kukhalapo kwa endogenous cycles ndi kupanga kwawo kudzera mu mawotchi a zamoyo.

en: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
ny: Nthaŵi ndi nthaŵi, zimene sizimangoyankha ku zizindikiro zakunja za nthaŵi ndi nthaŵi, zalembedwa kwa zamoyo zambiri, kuphatikizapo mabakiteriya, bowa, zomera, ndi nyama.

en: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
ny: Mawotchi a zamoyo ndi odzichirikiza okha oscillators omwe adzapitiriza nthawi yoyendetsa njinga yaulere ngakhale palibe zizindikiro zakunja.

en: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
ny: Kuyesera kwa Hershey ndi Chase kunali chimodzi mwa malingaliro otsogolera kuti DNA inali chibadwa.

en: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
ny: Hershey ndi Chase anagwiritsira ntchito phages, kapena mavairasi, kuika DNA yawo m'bakiteriya.

en: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
ny: Iwo anachita mayesero aŵiri osonyeza DNA mu phage ndi radioactive phosphorous kapena mapuloteni a phage ndi radioactive sulfure.

en: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.
ny: Kusintha kungakhale ndi zotsatira zosiyanasiyana zosiyanasiyana malinga ndi mtundu wa kusintha, kufunika kwa chidutswa cha majini omwe akukhudzidwa komanso ngati maselo omwe akukhudzidwa ndi maselo a majeremusi.

en: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
ny: Kusintha kokha kwa maselo a majeremusi kungaperekedwe kwa ana, pamene kusintha kwina kulikonse kungayambitse imfa ya maselo kapena khansa.

en: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.
ny: Zokopa alendo zachilengedwe zimakopa anthu omwe ali ndi chidwi choyendera malo achilengedwe ndi cholinga chosangalala ndi malo, kuphatikizapo zomera ndi nyama zakutchire.

en: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.
ny: Zitsanzo za ntchito za pamalopo zikuphatikizapo kusaka, kusodza, kujambula zithunzi, kuyang'ana mbalame, ndi kuyendera mapaki ndi kuphunzira zambiri zokhudza chilengedwe.

en: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
ny: Chitsanzo ndi kuyendera, kujambula zithunzi, ndi kuphunzira za organgatuangs ku Borneo.

en: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.
ny: M'mawa uliwonse, anthu amachoka m'matauni ang'onoang'ono akumidzi m'magalimoto kupita kumalo awo antchito ndipo amadutsa ndi ena omwe malo awo ogwira ntchito ndi malo omwe angochoka kumene.

en: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.
ny: Mu shuttle iyi yoyendera yamphamvu aliyense mwanjira inayake amagwirizanitsidwa ndi, ndi kuthandizira, njira yoyendera yochokera ku magalimoto apadera.

en: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
ny: Sayansi tsopano ikusonyeza kuti chuma chachikulu cha carbon chimenechi chachotsa biosphere kuchokera ku imodzi mwa mayiko ake okhazikika omwe athandizira chisinthiko cha anthu kwa zaka mamiliyoni awiri zapitazi.

en: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.
ny: Aliyense amatenga nawo mbali m'chitaganya ndipo amagwiritsa ntchito njira zoyendera. Pafupifupi aliyense amadandaula za njira zoyendera.

en: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.
ny: M'maiko otukuka simumva kaŵirikaŵiri madandaulo ofananawo ponena za madzi kapena milatho ikugwa.

en: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
ny: Kodi nchifukwa ninji njira zoyendera zimayambitsa madandaulo oterowo, kodi nchifukwa ninji zimalephera tsiku ndi tsiku? Kodi akatswiri oyendetsa mayendedwe alibe luso? Kapena kodi chinachake chofunika kwambiri chikuchitika?

en: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.
ny: Kuyenda kwa Magalimoto ndi phunziro la kayendedwe ka madalaivala ndi magalimoto payekha pakati pa mfundo ziwiri ndi kuyanjana zomwe amapanga wina ndi mnzake.

en: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.
ny: Tsoka ilo, kuphunzira kayendedwe ka magalimoto ndikovuta chifukwa khalidwe la dalaivala silingathe kuneneratu ndi chitsimikizo cha peresenti zana limodzi.

en: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.
ny: Mwamwayi, madalaivala amakonda kuchita zinthu moyenera mosasinthasintha; choncho, mitsinje magalimoto amakonda kukhala ena kugwirizana wololera ndipo akhoza mwachisawawa anaimira masamu.

en: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.
ny: Kuti aimirire bwino kayendedwe ka magalimoto, maubwenzi akhazikitsidwa pakati pa makhalidwe atatu akuluakulu: (1) kuyenda, (2) kuchuluka, ndi (3) kuthamanga.

en: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
ny: Maubwenzi awa amathandiza pakukonzekera, kupanga, ndi ntchito za malo amsewu.

en: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
ny: Tizilombo tinali nyama zoyamba kutenga mlengalenga. Kutha kwawo kuuluka kunawathandiza kuzemba adani mosavuta ndi kupeza chakudya ndi anzawo bwino kwambiri.

en: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.
ny: Tizilombo tambiri timakhala ndi mwayi wokhoza kupinda mapiko awo m'mphepete mwa thupi.

en: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.
ny: Izi zimawapatsa malo ang'onoang'ono osiyanasiyana obisala ku nyama zolusa.

en: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.
ny: Lerolino, tizilombo tokha timene sitingathe kupinda mapiko awo ndi ntchentche za chinjoka ndi ntchentche.

en: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.
ny: Zaka zikwi zambiri zapitazo, mwamuna wina wotchedwa Aristarchus ananena kuti Solar System inazungulira Dzuwa.

en: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).
ny: Anthu ena ankaganiza kuti anali wolondola koma anthu ambiri ankakhulupirira zosiyana; kuti Dongosolo la Dzuwa linayenda mozungulira Dziko Lapansi, kuphatikizapo Dzuwa (ndipo ngakhale nyenyezi zina).

en: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?
ny: Izi zikuwoneka zomveka, chifukwa Dziko lapansi silimamva ngati likuyenda, kodi?

en: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.
ny: Mtsinje wa Amazon ndi wachiwiri wautali kwambiri komanso mtsinje waukulu kwambiri padziko lapansi. Imanyamula madzi oposa 8 kuposa mtsinje wachiwiri waukulu kwambiri.

en: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.
ny: Amazon imakhalanso mtsinje waukulu kwambiri padziko lapansi, nthawi zina makilomita asanu ndi limodzi m'lifupi.

en: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.
ny: Madzi okwanira 20 peresenti amene amatsanulira m'mitsinje ya pulaneti kuloŵa m'nyanja amachokera ku Amazon.

en: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ny: Mtsinje waukulu wa Amazon ndi makilomita 6,387 (3,980 miles). Amasonkhanitsa madzi m'mitsinje yaing'ono zikwizikwi.

en: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.
ny: Ngakhale kuti kumanga piramidi m'miyala kunapitirizabe mpaka kumapeto kwa Ufumu Wakale, mapiramidi a Giza sanapambane konse mu kukula kwawo ndi luso lapamwamba la kumanga kwawo.

en: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
ny: Aigupto akale a Ufumu Watsopano anadabwa ndi zipilala za oyambirira awo, zimene panthaŵiyo zinali zoposa zaka chikwi.

en: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.
ny: Chiwerengero cha anthu a ku Vatican City chili pafupi ndi 800. Ndi dziko laling'ono lodziimira palokha padziko lonse lapansi komanso dziko lomwe lili ndi anthu ochepa kwambiri.

en: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.
ny: Mzinda wa Vatican umagwiritsa ntchito Chitaliyana m'malamulo ake ndi mauthenga ovomerezeka.

en: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.
ny: Chitaliyana chimakhalanso chinenero cha tsiku ndi tsiku chogwiritsidwa ntchito ndi ambiri omwe amagwira ntchito m'boma pamene Chilatini nthawi zambiri chimagwiritsidwa ntchito pa miyambo yachipembedzo.

en: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ny: Nzika zonse za Vatican City ndi Roma Katolika.

en: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.
ny: Anthu akhala akudziwa za zinthu zoyambirira za mankhwala monga golide, siliva, ndi mkuwa kuyambira kalekale, chifukwa zonsezi zikhoza kupezeka m'chilengedwe m'mawonekedwe achibadwidwe ndipo zimakhala zosavuta kukumba ndi zipangizo zakale.

en: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
ny: Aristotle, wafilosofi, ananena kuti chirichonse chimapangidwa ndi chisakanizo cha chinthu chimodzi kapena zingapo mwa zinayi. Iwo anali dziko lapansi, madzi, mpweya, ndi moto.

en: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.
ny: Izi zinali zofanana kwambiri ndi mayiko anayi a zinthu (m'dongosolo lomwelo): zolimba, zamadzimadzi, mpweya, ndi plasma, ngakhale kuti iye ananenanso kuti zimasintha kukhala zinthu zatsopano kuti apange zomwe tikuwona.

en: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
ny: Aloyi kwenikweni ndi osakaniza zitsulo ziwiri kapena kuposa. Musaiwale kuti pali zinthu zambiri patebulo la periodic.

en: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.
ny: Zinthu monga calcium ndi potaziyamu zimaonedwa ngati zitsulo. Ndithudi, palinso zitsulo monga siliva ndi golide.

en: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.
ny: Mukhozanso kukhala ndi aloyi omwe amaphatikizapo zinthu zochepa zopanda zitsulo monga carbon.

en: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.
ny: Chilichonse m'Chilengedwe chonse chimapangidwa ndi zinthu. Zinthu zonse zimapangidwa ndi tinthu tating'onoting'ono totchedwa maatomu.

en: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.
ny: Maatomu ndi ang'onoang'ono kwambiri moti ma trillion a iwo akhoza kukwanira mu nthawi kumapeto kwa chiganizochi.

en: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.
ny: Choncho, pensulo inali bwenzi labwino kwa anthu ambiri pamene inatuluka.

en: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
ny: Mwachisoni, pamene njira zatsopano zolemba zatuluka, pensulo yabwezeretsedwa ku malo ochepa ndi ntchito.

en: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.
ny: Anthu tsopano amalemba mauthenga pa makompyuta, osafika pafupi ndi wakuthwa.

en: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.
ny: Munthu angangodabwa kuti kiyibodi idzakhala yotani pamene chinachake chatsopano chibwera.

en: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.
ny: Bomba la fission limagwira ntchito pa mfundo yakuti pamafunika mphamvu kuti muike pamodzi nyukiliya yokhala ndi mapulotoni ambiri ndi manyutuloni.

en: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.
ny: Mtundu ngati kugubuduza ngolo yolemera kukwera phiri. Kugawa nucleus kachiwiri kenako kumatulutsa mphamvu zina zimenezo.

en: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
ny: Maatomu ena ali ndi nuclei osakhazikika zomwe zikutanthauza kuti amakonda kusweka ndi zochepa kapena palibe nudging.

en: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.
ny: Pamwamba pa Mwezi amapangidwa ndi miyala ndi fumbi. Mbali yakunja ya Mwezi imatchedwa crust.

en: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
ny: Mphukira ndi pafupifupi 70 km wandiweyani pafupi ndi 100 km wandiweyani kumbali yakutali.

en: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
ny: Ndi woonda pansi pa maria ndi wandiweyani pansi pa mapiri.

en: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
ny: Pangakhale maria wambiri kumbali yapafupi chifukwa chakuti chitumbuwa chimakhala chochepa. Zinali zosavuta kuti matalala akwere pamwamba.

en: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
ny: Nthanthi zamkati zimazikidwa pa kupeza zomwe zimapangitsa anthu kukhala ndi tick kapena kuwakopa.

en: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
ny: Nthanthi izi zikusonyeza kuti anthu ali ndi zosowa zina ndi / kapena zokhumba zomwe zakhala zamkati pamene zikukhwima mpaka uchikulire.

en: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
ny: Nthanthi zimenezi zimayang'ana zomwe zili za anthu ena zomwe zimawapangitsa kufuna zinthu zomwe amachita komanso zomwe zinthu m'malo awo zidzawapangitsa kuchita kapena kusachita zinthu zina.

en: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ny: Nthanthi ziwiri zotchuka zokhudzana ndi Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory ndi Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

en: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).
ny: Nthawi zambiri, makhalidwe awiri amatha kutuluka pamene oyang'anira akuyamba kutsogolera anzawo akale. Mapeto amodzi a sipekitiramu akuyesera kukhalabe "mmodzi wa anyamata" (kapena gals).

en: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
ny: Woyang'anira wamtunduwu amavutika kupanga zosankha zosasangalatsa, kuchita chilango, kuyesa ntchito, kupereka udindo, ndi kuimba anthu mlandu.

en: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
ny: Kumapeto kwina kwa sipekitiramu, wina amasintha kukhala munthu wosadziwika yemwe amaona kuti ayenera kusintha zonse zomwe gulu lakhala likuchita ndikupanga zawo.

en: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
ny: Ndipotu, mtsogoleri pamapeto pake ali ndi udindo wopambana ndi kulephera kwa timu.

en: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
ny: Khalidwe limeneli nthawi zambiri limachititsa kusagwirizana pakati pa atsogoleri ndi gulu lonse.

en: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
ny: Magulu enieni amagwiritsidwa ntchito ku miyezo yofanana yabwino kwambiri monga magulu amwambo, koma pali kusiyana kwachinyengo.

en: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
ny: Mamembala a gulu pafupifupi nthawi zambiri amagwira ntchito ngati mfundo yolumikizana ndi gulu lawo la thupi lapafupi.

en: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
ny: Nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi ufulu wodzilamulira kuposa mamembala a gulu lachizolowezi monga magulu awo angakumane malinga ndi nthawi zosiyanasiyana zomwe sizingamvetsetsedwe ndi oyang'anira awo am'deralo.

en: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
ny: Kukhalapo kwa "gulu losaoneka" lenileni (Larson ndi LaFasto, 1989, p109) ndi gawo lapadera la gulu lenileni.

en: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
ny: "Gulu losaoneka" ndi gulu loyang'anira lomwe aliyense wa mamembala amapereka lipoti. Gulu losaoneka limakhazikitsa miyezo kwa membala aliyense.

en: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
ny: N'chifukwa chiyani bungwe lingafune kudutsa nthawi yowononga nthawi yokhazikitsa bungwe lophunzira? Cholinga chimodzi choyika malingaliro ophunzirira bungwe ndi luso.

en: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
ny: Pamene zipangizo zonse zilipo bwino ntchito kudutsa madipatimenti ntchito ya bungwe, luso ndi nzeru akhoza transpire.

en: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
ny: Zotsatira zake, ndondomeko ya bungwe lomwe likugwira ntchito limodzi kuti ligonjetse chopinga lingachititse njira yatsopano yatsopano yotumikira zosowa za kasitomala.

en: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
ny: Bungwe lisanakhale latsopano, utsogoleri uyenera kupanga chikhalidwe cha zatsopano komanso chidziwitso chogawana ndi kuphunzira kwa bungwe.

en: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
ny: Angel (2006), akufotokoza njira ya Continuum ngati njira yomwe ikugwiritsidwa ntchito kuthandiza mabungwe kufika pamlingo wapamwamba wa ntchito.

en: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
ny: Deta ya neurobiological imapereka umboni wakuthupi wa njira yamaphunziro pakufufuza za kuzindikira. Chifukwa chake zimachepetsa malo ofufuza ndikupanga kukhala enieni kwambiri.

en: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
ny: Kugwirizana pakati pa matenda a ubongo ndi khalidwe kumathandizira asayansi pakufufuza kwawo.

en: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
ny: Zakhala zikudziwika kwa nthawi yaitali kuti mitundu yosiyanasiyana ya kuwonongeka kwa ubongo, kuvulala, zilonda, ndi zotupa zimakhudza khalidwe ndipo zimayambitsa kusintha kwa ntchito zina zamaganizo.

en: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
ny: Kukwera kwa matekinoloje atsopano kumatilola kuwona ndi kufufuza mapangidwe a ubongo ndi njira zomwe sizinawonedwepo.

en: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
ny: Izi zimatipatsa chidziwitso chambiri ndi zinthu zomangira zitsanzo zoyerekezera zomwe zimatithandiza kumvetsetsa ndondomeko m'maganizo mwathu.

en: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
ny: Ngakhale AI ili ndi tanthauzo lamphamvu la sayansi yopeka, AI imapanga nthambi yofunika kwambiri ya sayansi yamakompyuta, kuthana ndi khalidwe, kuphunzira ndi kusintha kwanzeru mu makina.

en: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
ny: Kafukufuku mu AI amaphatikizapo kupanga makina kuti azigwiritsa ntchito ntchito zomwe zimafuna khalidwe lanzeru.

en: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
ny: Zitsanzo zikuphatikizapo kulamulira, kukonzekera ndi ndandanda, kuthekera koyankha matenda a makasitomala ndi mafunso, komanso kuzindikira zolemba pamanja, mawu ndi nkhope.

en: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
ny: Zinthu zoterozo zakhala zilango zosiyana, zimene zimasumika maganizo pa kupereka njira zothetsera mavuto enieni a moyo.

en: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
ny: Dongosolo la AI tsopano nthawi zambiri limagwiritsidwa ntchito m'madera a zachuma, mankhwala, zomangamanga ndi asilikali, monga momwe zamangidwira mu mapulogalamu angapo a mapulogalamu a kompyuta ndi masewera a kanema.

en: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
ny: Maulendo am'munda ndi gawo lalikulu la kalasi iliyonse. Kaŵirikaŵiri mphunzitsi angakonde kutenga ophunzira ake malo kumene ulendo wa basi suli njira.

en: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
ny: Technology imapereka yankho ndi maulendo am'munda pafupifupi. Ophunzira akhoza kuyang'ana zinthu zakale zakale, kupita ku aquarium, kapena kusirira luso lokongola pamene akukhala ndi kalasi yawo.

en: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
ny: Kugawana ulendo wakumunda pafupifupi ndi njiranso yabwino yoganizira za ulendo ndikugawana zochitika ndi makalasi amtsogolo.

en: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, chaka chilichonse ophunzira ochokera ku Bennet School ku North Carolina amapanga webusaiti yokhudza ulendo wawo wopita ku State Capital, chaka chilichonse webusaitiyi imakonzedwanso, koma mabaibulo akale amasungidwa pa intaneti kuti akhale ngati scrapbook.

en: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
ny: Mabulogu angathandizenso kuwongolera kulemba kwa ophunzira. Ngakhale ophunzira nthawi zambiri amayamba zochitika zawo za blog ndi galamala yonyansa ndi kalembedwe, kukhalapo kwa omvera nthawi zambiri kumasintha zimenezo.

en: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
ny: Popeza ophunzira nthawi zambiri amakhala omvera otsutsa kwambiri, wolemba blog amayamba kuyesetsa kukonza zolemba kuti apewe kutsutsidwa.

en: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
ny: Komanso kulemba mabulogu "kumakakamiza ophunzira kukhala savvy kwambiri za dziko lowazungulira." Kufunika kwa kudyetsa chidwi cha omvera kumalimbikitsa ophunzira kukhala ochenjera komanso osangalatsa (Toto, 2004) .

en: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
ny: Kulemba mabulogu ndi chida chomwe chimalimbikitsa mgwirizano, ndipo chimalimbikitsa ophunzira kuti awonjezere kuphunzira bwino kupitirira tsiku la sukulu lachikhalidwe.

en: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito bwino mabulogu "kungapatse mphamvu ophunzira kuti akhale owunikira komanso ovuta; kudzera mwachangu kuyankha zipangizo Internet, ophunzira akhoza kufotokoza malo awo mu nkhani ya zolemba ena 'komanso kufotokoza maganizo awo pa nkhani zina (Oravec, 2002) .

en: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.
ny: Ottawa ndi likulu lokongola la Canada, la zilankhulo ziwiri ndipo lili ndi malo ambiri ojambula zithunzi ndi malo osungirako zinthu zakale omwe amasonyeza zakale ndi zamakono za Canada.

en: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
ny: Kum'mwera kwambiri ndi mathithi a Niagara ndipo kumpoto kuli kukongola kwachilengedwe kosagwiritsidwa ntchito kwa Muskoka ndi kupitirira.

en: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
ny: Zinthu zonsezi ndi zambiri kuwunikira Ontario monga zimene zimaonedwa quintessentially Canada ndi akunja.

en: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
ny: Madera akuluakulu kumpoto ali ndi anthu ochepa kwambiri ndipo ena ali pafupifupi chipululu chopanda anthu.

en: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
ny: Poyerekeza anthu omwe amadabwitsa ambiri: Pali anthu ambiri a ku Africa a ku America omwe amakhala ku US kuposa nzika za Canada.

en: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
ny: Zilumba za East Africa zili m'nyanja ya Indian Ocean pafupi ndi gombe la kum'mawa kwa Africa.

en: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
ny: Madagascar ndi dziko lalikulu kwambiri, ndipo ndi kontinenti yokha pankhani ya nyama zakutchire.

en: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
ny: Zilumba zambiri zing'onozing'ono ndi mayiko odziimira pawokha, kapena ogwirizana ndi France, ndipo amadziwika kuti malo apamwamba a m'mphepete mwa nyanja.

en: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
ny: Aluya anabweretsanso Chisilamu ku maiko, ndipo chinatenga njira yaikulu ku Comoros ndi Mayotte.

en: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
ny: Chisonkhezero cha ku Ulaya ndi utsamunda zinayamba m'zaka za zana la 15, pamene wofufuza malo wa chipwitikizi Vasco da Gama anapeza Cape Route kuchokera ku Ulaya kupita ku India.

en: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
ny: Kumpoto dera ndi malire ndi Sahel, ndi kum'mwera ndi kumadzulo ndi Atlantic Ocean.

en: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
ny: Akazi: Tikulimbikitsidwa kuti akazi alionse apaulendo azinena kuti ndi okwatira, mosasamala kanthu za ukwati weniweni.

en: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
ny: Ndizothandiza kuvalanso mphete (osati yomwe ikuwoneka yodula kwambiri.

en: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
ny: Azimayi ayenera kuzindikira kuti kusiyana kwa chikhalidwe kungayambitse zomwe angaganize kuti ndi kuvutitsidwa ndipo si zachilendo kutsatiridwa, kugwidwa ndi mkono, ndi zina zotero.

en: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
ny: Khalani olimba pokana amuna, ndipo musaope kuima pansi (kusiyana kwa chikhalidwe kapena ayi, sizikupanga bwino!).

en: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
ny: Mzinda wamakono wa Casablanca unakhazikitsidwa ndi asodzi a Berber m'zaka za zana la 10 BCE, ndipo unagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi Afoinike, Aroma, ndi Merenids monga doko lapadera lotchedwa Anfa.

en: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
ny: Apwitikizi anaiwononga ndi kuimanganso pansi pa dzina lakuti Casa Branca, koma anaisiya pambuyo pa chivomezi mu 1755.

en: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.
ny: Mfumu ya Morocco inamanganso mzindawu ngati Daru l-Badya ndipo inapatsidwa dzina lakuti Casablanca ndi amalonda a ku Spain omwe anakhazikitsa malo ogulitsa kumeneko.

en: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.
ny: Casablanca ndi imodzi mwa malo osangalatsa kwambiri ogula ku Morocco konse.

en: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.
ny: Kuzungulira Medina wakale n'zosavuta kupeza malo ogulitsa katundu wachikhalidwe cha Morocco, monga tagines, mbiya, katundu wachikopa, hookahs, ndi mtundu wonse wa geegaws, koma zonse ndi alendo.

en: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.
ny: Goma ndi mzinda wa alendo wa Democratic Republic of Congo kum'mawa kwambiri pafupi ndi Rwanda.

en: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre.
ny: Mu 2002 Goma anawonongedwa ndi matalala ochokera ku phiri la Nyiragongo lomwe linakwirira misewu yambiri ya m'tawuniyi, makamaka pakati pa tawuniyi.

en: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.
ny: Ngakhale Goma ndi wotetezeka moyenera, maulendo aliwonse kunja kwa Goma ayenera kufufuzidwa kuti amvetsetse mkhalidwe wa nkhondo yomwe ikupitirizabe m'chigawo cha North Kivu.

en: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.
ny: Mzindawu umakhalanso maziko okwera phiri la Nyiragongo pamodzi ndi zina zotsika mtengo kwambiri za Mountain Gorilla ku Africa.

en: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.
ny: Mukhoza kugwiritsa ntchito boda-boda (taxi ya njinga yamoto) kuti muzungulire Goma. Mtengo wabwinobwino (wakomweko) ndi ~ 500 Francs ya ku Congo paulendo waufupi.

en: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.
ny: Kuphatikizidwa ndi kusafikirika kwake kwachibale, "Timbuktu" yakhala ikugwiritsidwa ntchito ngati fanizo la mayiko achilendo, akutali.

en: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.
ny: Masiku ano, Timbuktu ndi tawuni yosauka, ngakhale kuti mbiri yake imapangitsa kuti ikhale malo ochezera alendo, ndipo ili ndi ndege.

en: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.
ny: Mu 1990, inawonjezeredwa pa mndandanda wa malo a dziko lapansi omwe ali pangozi, chifukwa cha chiwopsezo cha mchenga wa m'chipululu.

en: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.
ny: Inali imodzi mwazoyimira zazikulu panthawi ya Henry Louis Gates 'PBS zodabwitsa zapadera za Dziko la Africa.

en: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.
ny: Mzindawu ndi wosiyana kwambiri ndi mizinda yonse ya m'dzikoli, chifukwa uli ndi luso la Chiarabu kuposa la munthu wa ku Africa.

en: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.
ny: Kruger National Park (KNP) ili kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa South Africa ndipo imayenda m'malire a Mozambique kum'mawa, Zimbabwe kumpoto, ndipo malire akumwera ndi mtsinje wa Crocodile.

en: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.
ny: Pakiyi imakhala ndi makilomita 19,500 ndipo imagawidwa m'madera osiyanasiyana a 14, aliyense akuthandizira nyama zakutchire zosiyanasiyana.

en: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
ny: Ndi chimodzi mwa zokopa zazikulu za South Africa ndipo zimaonedwa ngati flagship ya South African National Parks (SANParks).

en: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.
ny: Mofanana ndi malo onse a South African National Parks, pali ndalama zosungira tsiku ndi tsiku komanso zolowera m'pakiyi.

en: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.
ny: Zingakhalenso zopindulitsa kuti munthu agule Wild Card, yomwe imapereka kulowa m'mapaki osankhidwa ku South Africa kapena onse a South African National Parks.

en: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
ny: Chilumba cha Hong Kong chimapatsa dera la Hong Kong dzina lake ndipo ndi malo omwe alendo ambiri amaona kuti ndiwo cholinga chachikulu.

en: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.
ny: Parade ya nyumba zomwe zimapangitsa hong Kong skyline yayerekezedwa ndi tchati chonyezimira cha bar chomwe chimawonekera ndi kukhalapo kwa madzi a Victoria Harbour.

en: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.
ny: Kuti mupeze malingaliro abwino kwambiri a Hong Kong, chokani pachilumbachi ndikupita ku Kowloon waterfront moyang'anizana.

en: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.
ny: Chitukuko chachikulu cha mizinda ya chilumba cha Hong Kong chimadzazidwa kwambiri pamtunda wobwezeretsedwa m'mphepete mwa gombe la kumpoto.

en: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.
ny: Awa ndi malo omwe atsamunda a ku Britain anatenga ngati awo ndipo kotero ngati mukuyang'ana umboni wa zakale za atsamunda a gawolo, iyi ndi malo abwino oyamba.

en: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
ny: A Sundarban ndiwo lamba wamkulu kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi, wotambasula makilomita 80 (50 mi) kupita ku Bangladeshi ndi Indian hinterland kuchokera ku gombe.

en: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
ny: Sundarbans yalengezedwa kuti ndi UNESCO World Heritage Site. Mbali ya nkhalango mkati mwa dera la India imatchedwa Sundarbans National Park.

en: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.
ny: Ngakhale kuli tero, nkhalangozo siziri kokha madambo a mitengo ya mangrove — zimaphatikizapo zina za malo omalizira otsala a nkhalango zamphamvu zimene kale zinaphimba chigwa cha Gangetic.

en: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.
ny: Ma Sundarban amaphimba malo a 3,850 km², omwe pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu amaphimbidwa m'madera a madzi / marsh.

en: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
ny: Kuyambira mu 1966 a Sundarban akhala malo osungirako nyama zakutchire, ndipo akuti tsopano m'derali muli akambuku 400 a ku Royal Bengal ndipo m'derali muli akambuku pafupifupi 30,000.

en: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30.
ny: Mabasi amachoka pakati pa chigawo cha basi (kudutsa mtsinje) tsiku lonse, ngakhale ambiri, makamaka omwe akupita kum'mawa ndi Jakar / Bumthang amachoka pakati pa 06:30 ndi 07:30.

en: As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance.
ny: Monga mabasi a pakati pa zigawo nthawi zambiri amadzaza, ndibwino kugula tikiti masiku angapo pasadakhale.

en: Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy.
ny: Madera ambiri amatumikiridwa ndi mabasi ang'onoang'ono a Japanese Coaster, omwe ali omasuka komanso olimba.

en: Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).
ny: Matekisi ogawana ndi njira yofulumira komanso yabwino yopita kumalo oyandikana nawo, monga Paro (Nu 150) ndi Punakha (Nu 200).

en: The Oyapock River Bridge is a cable-stayed bridge. It spans the Oyapock River to link the cities of Oiapoque in Brazil and Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock in French Guiana.
ny: Mlatho wa Mtsinje wa Oyapock ndi mlatho wokhala ndi chingwe. Umadutsa mtsinje wa Oyapock kuti ugwirizanitse mizinda ya Oiapoque ku Brazil ndi Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock ku French Guiana.

en: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
ny: Nsanja ziwirizi zimakwera mpaka kutalika kwa mamita 83, zimakhala zazitali mamita 378 ndipo zimakhala ndi njira ziwiri za 3.50 m'lifupi.

en: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
ny: Chilolezo chozungulira pansi pa mlatho ndi mamita 15. Ntchito yomanga inatha mu Ogasiti 2011, sinatsegulidwe ku magalimoto mpaka March 2017.

en: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
ny: Mlathowu ukuyembekezeka kugwira ntchito mokwanira mu September 2017, pamene malo oyang'anira miyambo ya Brazil akuyembekezeka kutha.

en: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
ny: A Guaraní anali gulu lofunika kwambiri la anthu am'deralo omwe amakhala m'dera lomwe tsopano ndi Eastern Paraguay, akukhala ngati osaka nyama omwe amagwiranso ntchito zaulimi.

en: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
ny: Dera la Chaco linali ndi magulu ena a mafuko a eni dzikolo monga Guaycurú ndi Payaguá, omwe anapulumuka mwa kusaka, kusonkhana ndi kusodza.

en: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
ny: M'zaka za zana la 16 Paraguay, yomwe poyamba inkatchedwa "The Giant Province of the Indies", inabadwa chifukwa cha kukumana kwa ogonjetsa a ku Spain ndi magulu amtundu wa eni dzikolo.

en: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
ny: Anthu a ku Spain anayamba nthawi ya ulamuliro wa atsamunda yomwe inatenga zaka mazana atatu.

en: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
ny: Kuyambira maziko a Asunción mu 1537, Paraguay yakwanitsa kusunga zambiri za khalidwe lake lakumaloko ndi chizindikiritso chake.

en: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
ny: Argentina imadziwika bwino chifukwa chokhala ndi imodzi mwa magulu abwino kwambiri a polo ndi osewera padziko lonse lapansi.

en: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
ny: Mpikisano waukulu kwambiri wa chaka umachitika mu Disembala ku minda ya polo ku Las Cañitas.

en: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
ny: Mipikisano yaying'ono ndi machesi amatha kuwonedwa pano nthawi zina pachaka.

en: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
ny: Kuti mudziwe zambiri pa masewera komanso komwe mungagule matikiti a masewera a polo, onani Asociacion Argentina de Polo.

en: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
ny: Ndalama ya boma ya Falklands ndi mapaundi a Falkland (FKP) omwe mtengo wake umakhazikitsidwa wofanana ndi mapaundi amodzi a ku Britain (GBP).

en: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
ny: Ndalama zikhoza kusinthidwa ku banki yokhayo m'zilumba zomwe zili ku Stanley kudutsa ku sitolo ya FIC West.

en: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
ny: Mapaundi a ku Britain nthawi zambiri adzalandiridwa kulikonse m'zilumbazi ndipo mkati mwa makadi a ngongole a Stanley ndi madola a United States amavomerezedwa nthawi zambiri.

en: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
ny: Pa zilumba zakunja makadi a ngongole mwina sadzalandiridwa, ngakhale ndalama za British ndi United States zingatengedwe; fufuzani ndi eni ake pasadakhale kuti mudziwe zomwe zili njira yovomerezeka yolipira.

en: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
ny: N'zosatheka pafupifupi kusinthanitsa ndalama za Falklands kunja kwa zilumba, choncho kusinthanitsa ndalama musanachoke pazilumbazi.

en: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
ny: Popeza Montevideo ili kum'mwera kwa Equator, ndi chilimwe kumeneko pamene ndi chisanu ku Northern Hemisphere ndipo mosiyana.

en: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
ny: Montevideo ali mu subtropics; m'miyezi ya chilimwe, kutentha pamwamba pa + 30 ° C ndizofala.

en: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
ny: Nyengo yozizira ikhoza kukhala yozizira mwachinyengo: kutentha sikumapita kawirikawiri pansi pa kuzizira, koma mphepo ndi chinyezi zimagwirizana kuti zikhale zozizira kuposa zomwe thermometer imanena.

en: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
ny: Palibe nyengo zapadera za "mvula" ndi "zouma": kuchuluka kwa mvula kumakhala kofanana chaka chonse.

en: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
ny: Ngakhale kuti nyama zambiri m'pakimo zinazolowera kuona anthu, nyama zakutchirezo n'zakutchire ndipo siziyenera kudyetsedwa kapena kusokonezedwa.

en: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
ny: Malinga ndi akuluakulu a paki, khalani osachepera mamita 100 / mamita kuchokera ku zimbalangondo ndi mimbulu ndi mamita 25 / mamita kuchokera ku nyama zina zonse zakutchire!

en: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
ny: Mosasamala kanthu za mmene angaonekere kukhala ogonjera, njati, elk, nswala, zimbalangondo, ndi pafupifupi nyama zonse zazikulu zingaukirire.

en: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
ny: Chaka chilichonse, alendo ambiri amavulala chifukwa sanasunge mtunda woyenera. Nyama zimenezi ndi zazikulu, zakutchire, komanso zomwe zingakhale zoopsa, choncho zimawapatsa malo awo.

en: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
ny: Kuphatikiza apo, dziwani kuti fungo limakopa zimbalangondo ndi nyama zina zakutchire, choncho pewani kunyamula kapena kuphika zakudya zonunkhira ndikusunga msasa woyera.

en: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
ny: Apia ndi likulu la Samoa. Tawuniyi ili pachilumba cha Upolu ndipo ili ndi anthu pafupifupi 40,000.

en: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
ny: Apia inakhazikitsidwa m'zaka za m'ma 1850 ndipo yakhala likulu lovomerezeka la Samoa kuyambira 1959.

en: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
ny: Doko linali malo a kuyimilira kwa panyanja koipa mu 1889 pamene zombo zisanu ndi ziwiri zochokera ku Germany, US, ndi Britain zinakana kuchoka pa doko.

en: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
ny: Zombo zonse zinamizidwa, kupatulapo chombo chimodzi cha ku Britain. Pafupifupi miyoyo 200 ya ku America ndi Germany inatayika.

en: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
ny: Mkati mwa kulimbana kwa ufulu wodzilamulira kolinganizidwa ndi gulu la Mau, msonkhano wamtendere m'tauniyo unachititsa kuphedwa kwa mfumu yaikulu Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.

en: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
ny: Pali magombe ambiri, chifukwa cha Auckland's straddling of two harbours. Otchuka kwambiri ali m'madera atatu.

en: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
ny: Magombe a North Shore (m'chigawo cha North Harbour) ali pa nyanja ya Pacific ndipo amachokera ku Long Bay kumpoto mpaka ku Devonport kumwera.

en: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
ny: Pafupifupi magombe onse a mchenga omwe ali ndi kusambira kotetezeka, ndipo ambiri ali ndi mthunzi woperekedwa ndi mitengo ya pohutukawa.

en: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
ny: Magombe a Tamaki Drive ali pa Waitemata Harbour, m'madera apamwamba a Mission Bay ndi St Heliers ku Central Auckland.

en: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
ny: Awa nthawi zina ndi magombe a banja odzaza ndi masitolo abwino omwe ali m'mphepete mwa nyanja. Kusambira kuli kotetezeka.

en: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta".
ny: Mowa waukulu wakomweko ndi 'Nambala Yoyamba', si mowa wovuta, koma wosangalatsa komanso wotsitsimutsa. Mowa wina wakomweko umatchedwa "Manta".

en: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
ny: Pali vinyo wambiri wa ku France woyenera kukhala nawo, koma vinyo wa New Zealand ndi Australia angayende bwino.

en: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
ny: Madzi a m'mipope a m'deralo ndi otetezeka kwambiri kumwa, koma madzi a m'mabotolo ndi osavuta kupeza ngati mukuchita mantha.

en: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
ny: Kwa anthu aku Australia, lingaliro la khofi 'woyera woyera' ndi lachilendo. Wakuda wamfupi ndi 'espresso', cappuccino amabwera ataunjika mkulu ndi kirimu (osati froth), ndipo tiyi amaperekedwa popanda mkaka.

en: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
ny: Chokoleti chotentha chimakhala ndi miyezo ya Belgium. Madzi a zipatso ndi okwera mtengo koma abwino kwambiri.

en: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
ny: Maulendo ambiri opita ku reef amapangidwa chaka chonse, ndipo kuvulala chifukwa cha chilichonse mwa zifukwa izi pa reef ndizochepa.

en: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
ny: Komabe, tengani malangizo kwa akuluakulu a boma, mverani zizindikiro zonse, ndipo tcherani khutu kwambiri ku machenjezo a chitetezo.

en: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
ny: Box jellyfish imachitika pafupi ndi magombe ndi pafupi ndi mitsinje ya mtsinje kuyambira October mpaka April kumpoto kwa 1770. Nthawi zina amatha kupezeka kunja kwa nthawi zino.

en: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
ny: Komabe, nsombazi siziukira anthu kaŵirikaŵiri. Nsomba zambiri za shaki zimaopa anthu ndipo zingasambire.

en: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
ny: Ng'ona za m'madzi amchere sizimakhala mwachangu m'nyanja, malo awo oyambirira ali m'mitsinje ya mtsinje kumpoto kuchokera ku Rockhampton.

en: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
ny: Kusungitsa pasadakhale kumapatsa woyenda mtendere wamaganizo kuti adzakhala ndi malo ogona akangofika kumene akupita.

en: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
ny: Othandizira oyendayenda nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi mgwirizano ndi mahotela enieni, ngakhale kuti mungapeze kuti n'zotheka kusungitsa mitundu ina ya malo ogona, monga malo a msasa, kudzera mwa wothandizira maulendo.

en: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
ny: Othandizira oyendayenda nthawi zambiri amapereka ma phukusi omwe amaphatikizapo kadzutsa, makonzedwe oyendetsa kupita / kuchokera ku eyapoti kapena ngakhale kuphatikiza ndege ndi ma phukusi a hotelo.

en: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
ny: Amathanso kugwira kusungitsa kwa inu ngati mukufuna nthawi yoganizira za kupereka kapena kupeza zikalata zina zomwe mukupita (mwachitsanzo visa).

en: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
ny: Aliyense kusintha kapena zopempha ngakhale ayenera coursed kudzera wothandizira kuyenda choyamba osati mwachindunji ndi hotelo.

en: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
ny: Kwa zikondwerero zina, ambiri mwa oyang'anira zikondwerero za nyimbo amasankha kumanga msasa pamalopo, ndipo oyang'anira ambiri amaona kuti ndi gawo lofunika kwambiri pazochitikazo.

en: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
ny: Ngati mukufuna kukhala pafupi ndi zochita zomwe muyenera kulowa mwamsanga kuti mupeze malo a msasa pafupi ndi nyimbo.

en: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
ny: Kumbukirani kuti ngakhale kuti nyimbo pa magawo aakulu zingakhale zitatha, pangakhale zigawo za phwandolo zomwe zidzapitiriza kuimba nyimbo mpaka usiku.

en: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
ny: Zikondwerero zina zimakhala ndi malo apadera a msasa wa mabanja okhala ndi ana aang'ono.

en: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
ny: Ngati kudutsa kumpoto kwa Baltic m'nyengo yozizira, fufuzani malo a kanyumba, monga kudutsa ayezi kumayambitsa phokoso lowopsya kwambiri kwa omwe akukhudzidwa kwambiri.

en: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
ny: Maulendo apanyanja a Saint Petersburg amaphatikizapo nthawi m'tauni. Apaulendo apanyanja amamasuka ku zofunikira za visa (yang'anani mawu).

en: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
ny: Kaŵirikaŵiri juga zimayesetsa kwambiri kuwonjezera nthaŵi ndi ndalama zowonongedwa ndi alendo. Mawindo ndi mawotchi nthawi zambiri sakhalapo, ndipo kutuluka kungakhale kovuta kupeza.

en: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
ny: Nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi chakudya chapadera, zakumwa ndi zosangalatsa, kuti alendo akhale ndi maganizo abwino, ndikuwasunga pamalopo.

en: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
ny: Malo ena amapereka zakumwa zoledzeretsa panyumba. Komabe, kuledzera kumasokoneza chiweruzo, ndipo otchova juga onse abwino amadziŵa kufunika kwa kukhala odziletsa.

en: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures.
ny: Aliyense amene adzayendetsa galimoto pamalo okwera kwambiri kapena pamwamba pa mapiri ayenera kuganizira za kuthekera kwa chipale chofewa, ayezi, kapena kutentha kozizira.

en: On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt.
ny: Pa misewu yozizira ndi chipale chofewa, mikangano ndi yotsika ndipo simungathe kuyendetsa ngati kuti muli pa phula lopanda kanthu.

en: During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time.
ny: Pa blizzards, chipale chofewa chokwanira kuti inu anamangika akhoza kugwa mu nthawi yochepa kwambiri.

en: Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows.
ny: Kuwonekera kungakhalenso koletsedwa ndi kugwa kapena kuwomba chipale chofeŵa kapena ndi condensation kapena ayezi pazenera za galimoto.

en: On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.
ny: Kumbali ina, mikhalidwe yozizira ndi ya chipale chofeŵa njachibadwa m'maiko ambiri, ndipo magalimoto amapitirizabe mosadodometsedwa chaka chonse.

en: Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors.
ny: Safaris mwina ndi zokopa alendo kwambiri ku Africa komanso chinthu chofunika kwambiri kwa alendo ambiri.

en: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna.
ny: Mawu akuti safari mu ntchito yotchuka amatanthauza kuyenda pamtunda kuti awone nyama zakutchire zochititsa chidwi za ku Africa, makamaka pa savanna.

en: Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing.
ny: Nyama zina, monga njovu ndi nyamalikiti, zimakonda kuyandikira kwambiri magalimoto ndipo zipangizo zoyenera zidzalola kuwonera bwino.

en: Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars.
ny: Mikango, akambuku ndi anyalugwe nthawi zina amakhala amanyazi ndipo mudzawaona bwino ndi ma binoculars.

en: A walking safari (also called a "bush walk", "hiking safari", or going "footing") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days.
ny: Safari yoyenda (yomwe imatchedwanso "kuyenda kwa tchire", "kukwera safari", kapena kupita "mapazi") kumaphatikizapo kukwera, mwina kwa maola angapo kapena masiku angapo.

en: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan.
ny: Masewera a Paralympics adzachitika kuyambira 24 August mpaka 5 September 2021. Zochitika zina zidzachitika m'malo ena ku Japan konse.

en: Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964.
ny: Tokyo idzakhala mzinda wokha wa ku Asia womwe wakhala ndi masewera awiri a Olimpiki a chilimwe, popeza adachita masewerawa mu 1964.

en: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.
ny: Ngati munasungitsa ndege zanu ndi malo ogona a 2020 asanayambe kulengezedwa, mukhoza kukhala ndi mkhalidwe wonyenga.

en: Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled.
ny: Ndondomeko zoletsa zimasiyana, koma monga kumapeto kwa mwezi wa March ndondomeko zambiri zoletsa coronavirus sizikufika ku July 2020, pamene masewera a Olimpiki adakonzedwa.

en: It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.
ny: Zikuyembekezeka kuti matikiti ambiri a zochitika adzakhala pakati pa ¥ 2,500 ndi ¥ 130,000, ndi matikiti enieni omwe amawononga ndalama zozungulira ¥ 7,000.

en: Ironing damp clothes can help them dry. Many hotels have an iron and ironing board available for loan, even if one is not present in the room.
ny: Kusita zovala zonyowa kungawathandize kuuma. Mahotela ambiri ali ndi bolodi lachitsulo ndi kusita lomwe likupezeka kuti libwereke, ngakhale wina sapezeka m'chipinda.

en: If an iron isn't available, or if you don't fancy wearing ironed socks, then you can try using a hairdryer, if available.
ny: Ngati chitsulo sichipezeka, kapena ngati simukukonda kuvala masokosi a ironed, ndiye kuti mutha kuyesa kugwiritsa ntchito hairdryer, ngati ilipo.

en: Be careful not to allow fabric to become too hot (which can cause shrinkage, or in extreme cases, scorch).
ny: Samalani kuti musalole nsalu kukhala yotentha kwambiri (zomwe zingayambitse shrinkage, kapena nthawi zambiri, kuwotcha).

en: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats.
ny: Pali njira zosiyanasiyana zoyeretsera madzi, zina zothandiza kwambiri polimbana ndi zoopsa zapadera.

en: In some areas boiling water for a minute is enough, in others several minutes are needed.
ny: M'madera ena madzi otentha kwa mphindi imodzi ndi okwanira, ena pamafunika mphindi zingapo.

en: Filters vary in effectiveness, and should you have a concern, then you should consider buying your water in a sealed bottle from a reputable company.
ny: Zosefera zimasiyana ndi mphamvu, ndipo muyenera kukhala ndi nkhawa, ndiye kuti muyenera kuganizira kugula madzi anu mu botolo losindikizidwa kuchokera ku kampani yodziwika bwino.

en: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions.
ny: Apaulendo angakumane ndi tizilombo ta nyama timene sakuwadziwa bwino m'madera awo.

en: Pests can spoil food, cause irritation, or in a worse case cause allergic reactions, spread venom, or transmit infections.
ny: Tizilombo toyambitsa matenda timatha kuwononga chakudya, kukhumudwitsa, kapena m'zochitika zoipa kwambiri zimayambitsa matenda osokoneza bongo, kufalitsa poizoni, kapena kufalitsa matenda.

en: Infectious diseases themselves, or dangerous animals that can injure or kill people by force, do not usually qualify as pests.
ny: Matenda opatsirana enieniwo, kapena nyama zoopsa zomwe zingavulaze kapena kupha anthu mwamphamvu, nthawi zambiri siziyenerera kukhala tizilombo toyambitsa matenda.

en: Duty free shopping is the opportunity to buy goods exempted from taxes and excises at certain locations.
ny: Kugula kopanda msonkho ndi mwayi wogula katundu wochotsedwa ku misonkho ndi excises pamalo ena.

en: Travellers bound for countries with heavy taxation can sometimes save a considerable amount of money, especially on products such as alcoholic beverages and tobacco.
ny: Apaulendo opita ku mayiko omwe ali ndi misonkho yambiri nthawi zina amatha kusunga ndalama zambiri, makamaka pazinthu monga zakumwa zoledzeretsa ndi fodya.

en: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, passing frequently through isolated backwoods terrain.
ny: Kutambasula pakati pa Point Marion ndi Fairmont kumapereka zovuta kwambiri zoyendetsa galimoto pa Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, kudutsa pafupipafupi kudutsa m'malo akutali a backwoods.

en: If you're not used to driving on country roads, keep your wits about you: steep grades, narrow lanes, and sharp curves predominate.
ny: Ngati simunazolowere kuyendetsa galimoto m'misewu ya kumidzi, sungani nzeru zanu za inu: magiredi otsetsereka, njira zopapatiza, ndi zokhotakhota zakuthwa zimachuluka.

en: Posted speed limits are noticeably lower than in previous and subsequent sections — commonly 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) — and strict obedience to them is even more important than otherwise.
ny: Malire a liwiro oikidwa ndi otsika kwambiri kusiyana ndi zigawo zapitazo ndi zotsatira - kawirikawiri 35-40 mph (56-64 km / h) - ndipo kumvera kokhwima kwa iwo ndikofunikira kwambiri kuposa kwina.

en: Curiously, though, mobile phone service is much stronger here than along many other stretches of the route, e.g. the Pennsylvania Wilds.
ny: Komabe, modabwitsa, ntchito ya foni yam'manja ndi yamphamvu kwambiri pano kuposa m'madera ena ambiri a njirayi, mwachitsanzo Pennsylvania Wilds.

en: German pastries are quite good, and in Bavaria, are quite rich and varied, similar to those of their southern neighbor, Austria.
ny: Ma pastries a ku Germany ndi abwino kwambiri, ndipo ku Bavaria, ndi olemera kwambiri komanso osiyanasiyana, ofanana ndi a mnansi wawo wakumwera, Austria.

en: Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer.
ny: Zipatso za zipatso zimakhala zofala, ndi maapulo ophika mu pastries chaka chonse, ndi cherries ndi plums akupanga mawonekedwe awo m'chilimwe.

en: Many German baked goods also feature almonds, hazelnuts, and other tree nuts. Popular cakes often pair particularly well with a cup of strong coffee.
ny: Zinthu zambiri zophika za ku Germany zimakhalanso ndi amondi, hazelnuts, ndi mtedza wina wa mtengo. Makeke otchuka nthawi zambiri amagwirizana bwino kwambiri ndi kapu ya khofi wamphamvu.

en: If you want some small though rich pastries, try what depending on region are called Berliner, Pfannkuchen or Krapfen.
ny: Ngati mukufuna ena ang'onoang'ono ngakhale olemera pastries, yesani zimene malingana ndi dera amatchedwa Berliner, Pfannkuchen kapena Krapfen.

en: A curry is a dish based on herbs and spices, together with either meat or vegetables.
ny: A curry ndi mbale yochokera ku zitsamba ndi zonunkhira, pamodzi ndi nyama kapena ndiwo zamasamba.

en: A curry can be either "dry" or "wet" depending on the amount of liquid.
ny: A curry akhoza kukhala "wouma" kapena "wonyowa" malingana ndi kuchuluka kwa madzi.

en: In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used.
